Reviews.Title: Surprised by its performance but room for improvement
Reviews.Author: M. Kelley "mpkelley20"
Reviews.Content: I give this more of a 3 1/2 stars...I recently began looking into home video surveillance and home automation and acquired some products from a different manufacturer that lets you control video, thermostats, doors, lights, etc.. through a smartphone.  My issue with that set of products is the need for monthly subscription to use it as well as the high prices of the components.  I was very excited when I got the opportunity to try the Belkin video camera as it was cheaper and does not require a monthly subscription.  Sure, it doesn't have all the home automation features that the other system has but I was more concerned with the video monitoring anyway.  Overall I am pleased with how it works but there is definitely room for improvement.Getting the camera up and running was actually quite easy and did not require me to hook it up to a computer or my home router.  I simply connected it to my phone as a wifi connection, followed the instructions and then flipped a switch on the back of the camera to go into video mode.  The app I downloaded to control it was for my Iphone 4S.  Initially, when the first picture came up I was terribly disappointed in the quality.  It looked like complete haze.  That's when I realized that the box had been outside for a while and the lens was simply covered in fog.  I wiped it down and it looked much better.The video quality while viewing it over a wi-fi network on my Iphone was very good.  The camera angle is very wide so I can get a good portion of my first floor including my front door.  You can modify the quality of the video through the app so if you have less bandwidth, it will send a lower quality stream.  However, even at its best quality, its only 640x480.  Over a 3G connection, I had to manually turn down the video quality in order for it to be displayed but I didn't really notice much of a degradation in quality.  Guessing it's because the iphone screen is so small that it really doesn't matter.Here are the things I like about the camera1.  Cheaper than others I looked at.  Compared to the Nexia line of cameras, this is priced much better2.  No subscription required to use it3.  Quality is about as good as the Nexia ones I use4.  Night vision is pretty good.  All black and white but pretty clear5.  Sound!!!! Yes, this has the ability to stream audio as well which my nexia camera does not6.  Recording to the Iphone rather than some cloud server that limits your space7.  Like my more expensive solution, this does e-mail alerts based on motionHere are the things that can be improved1. The video is severely delayed and choppy.  This does not produce "real time" video like the nexia and seems to only capture a frame or two every few seconds regardless of what type of connection I am on2. Manual adjustment is annoying.  This seems like it could be an easy update to the app to allow the app to automatically adjust the quality settings when bandwidth is limited.  Waiting for a a minute or two and then getting a "sorry" message is annoying.  Please build in auto adjust for this.3. Load times can be long compared to other camera I have.Like I said, more of a 3 and a half stars with the ability for this to be a 4 star if they can improve the video fps and the bandwidth detection.  If those can be addressed either in software or a newer camera, this could be my solution for video surveillance around my house.  Will be a lot cheaper than paying a monthly fee for something that does the same thing!

Reviews.Title: I can't recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Luu
Reviews.Content: I'll start with what is good about this camera:1.  Small, reasonably well built.2.  Good night vision. I can see across the room for about 20 ft in total darkness.3.  Easy set up:  hint...when setting up, put the camera as close to your wifi router as possible. The signal strength is poor, and it can take for ever to connect, and usually doesn't connect at all. Other than that, set up is as simple as can be.4.  With good connection, the camera is very stable.  I've had it running 24/7 for a week now without issue.5.  Motion detector image capture...email notification works well.Why I wouldn't use this camera?1.  Wifi strength is poor.  I'm placing it 50 feet away, granted there are 2 interior walls in between, and signal drops off constantly.2.  Although the camera does have an ethernet port, the port is non-functional...compounding the weak wifi signal issue.3.  Software sucks... You can't view the camera on a computer.  You must use their iphone app.  The app sucks.  Worse of any camera app out there.  First off, it crashes all the time.  Second even on 4g LTE it has a hard time pulling videos through.  I'd have to downgrade the video quality substantially to get a video connection.  Third is it hardly works on Ipads...crashes more often than on the iphone.4.  Worse, most irritating part is that this camera is proprietary.  You can't view the camera with Blue iris or any other app/program.  This makes point #3 even worse.  I'm not an expert by any means, but I simply can't get this camera to behave like a typical IP cam.5.  Poor value. This camera doesn't tilt, pan, or zoom....for $100 bucks I'd go elsewhere.What would I recommend?  I now have done a ton of research and own 2 other systems...the Foscam 8910 and the Logitech Alert.  Here's my opinion of the 3 system for what it's worth:1.  My favorite is the Logitech Alert.  You want this if you have a newer house with normal electrical wiring.  By that I mean not spliced, added on, modified, etc.  The construction quality is best of the 3 by a mile.  Image quality during day, dim, and dark times are the best by far.  Set up is simple and brainless.  Signal connection and stability is much better than wifi.  Open architecture means you can view your camera through VLC, Blue iris, etc...so if Logitech goes belly up, your camera is still functional.  What I don't like about the Alert system is that there is no tilt/pan/zoom....false advertisement.  The software only support 6 cameras, although you can view more if you use Blue iris.  The app does suck, but you can use Blue iris which works great on both iphone and ipad.  These are more expensive (hint....much cheaper if you use the 'configure' option on Logitech's site)but are the best out there.2. Foscam is pretty good. Image quality is on par with the Belkin.  There's true tilt and pan, the ethernet port works, stable, fast, and the software and flexibility is just unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: SteelerFan4Life
Reviews.Content: I foster dogs and got this camera to watch them when I'm out of the house. It's really great for my needs. I put it on my mantle in my living room and the view is pretty wide so I can see the whole room. I have an iphone and nexus7 and it works on both. I setup the notifications and was getting them every few minutes when the dogs moved, so I stopped using it but it seemed to work really well.The only reason I'm giving it a 4 not a 5 is the audio could be better.

Reviews.Title: Very good picture quality, easy to set up, one flaw, possibly fatal
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the summary, since the review is a very long one. This is an indoor camera. Great picture quality (non HD), very easy to set up and operate, works well with Android tablet (I don't have any iOS device to test with, but I'd imagine it works just as well, or better) and you can let any number of friends view the camera - they don't need to own a camera. But there is one potential security issue with the camera.The flaw with this camera could be a deal breaker for some people, so I will mention it first. You need to create an account with Belkin, and anyone with access to the account will be able able access your camera.There is no way around that if you want to use this camera. You cannot operate it in "local only" mode (connect to the camera directly). There should be a way, but Belkin is not telling us what it is. If I find out through reverse engineering, I will update this review.Why is this important? If someone manages to guess your password, or if Belkin's security is compromised, you have no way of preventing people from looking into your house unless you turn it off. With other IP cameras, the password is only stored locally on the device, and is much less prone to being hacked. With some network expertise, you can create VPN tunnels that you need to connect to before you can view those type of cameras. You don't have such a choice with this one.This won't be an issue if the camera is being set up in a public area (for example, a restaurant). At home, however, I feel uncomfortable knowing that a stranger could be peering into my house.OK, now that this is out of the way, let us go on to the other features of this camera.Build quality : The camera is nicely constructed, smooth plastic shell that fits nicely together. The base is weighed down by a heavy metal washer at the base, so it will not topple over easily. The power supply cord is long - 10 feet (I measured). The stated output is 5V, 1.5A.Setup : the camera is very easy to configure, as long as you have an Android or iOS smartphone or a tablet. There is a little switch at the back of the camera - the only switch there, in fact. In the "up" position, it is in setup mode. In the "down" position, it is in camera mode. You should have received it in setup mode.When in setup mode, the camera powers up (by plugging in the power cable) and presents a wireless access point for your device to connect to. Use your phone or tablet's wifi setup to connect to it. There's no password. After you're connected, launch the app, which will guide you through the rest of the setup. If you messed something up, exit the app and launch it again. It will guide you through the steps all over again - connect to your home wifi router and register an account with Belkin - or log in to an existing account.Operation : Using the camera only requires you to flip the switch over to camera mode after you're done with the setup. Run the app, log in, and you're presented with a list of your cameras. Click on it and you can view it. You can also view the camera through your computer's browser by going to netcam dot belkin dot com (sorry for the minor obfuscation - Amazon seems to block most URLs I type in). In Firefox I'm prompted to install the iSecurity+ plugin, but I can use it with the old video player.(Edit 3/26 : n let me know in the comments below that it seems no longer possible to create an account from the login page. Not sure if this is temporary - I will check with Belkin and see what they say. For the moment - the following paragraph is no longer valid)You can create an account on a browser and view cameras that other people share with you even if you don't own a Netcam.  Anyone you share the camera with will need to do this. There are also public cameras available. At the time of this writing, there are two public netcams listed - both from the Silicon Valley Animal Control Authority.(Edit 3/26 : above paragraph is currently invalid - I need to find out from Belkin if it is permanently disabled)From the app or the browser, you can view your own cameras, your friends' cameras, and invite friends (by sending them an email) to view your cameras, and to revoke access to your camera. You can also set your own camera to "private" mode (meaning you're the only account that can view it).Infra-red works well, but in auto mode, the IR comes on whenever light level drops low enough, even when the camera is not being viewed. Alternatively you can set IR explicitly on or off (need to go into setup screen to do this). You cannot control the IR that someone shares with you, and motion detection will not work in the dark if IR is off. The IR LEDs gives off a faint reddish glow when in operation that's visible when it is very dark.There is no local (in-camera) recording capability. Recording is done by your phone using the app.Email motion detection alerts appear to work OK. You get an email with two photos when motion is detected. There doesn't appear to be a way to throttle the number of emails sent, so if you happen to have the camera pointed at a busy scene, be prepared for a flood of emails. A slowly changing scene will not trigger motion detection - for example, shadows cast by the sun moving slowly across the room will not trip it.Performance : The camera has a very clear picture and sound is decent. There is a small delay in video (about 0.25 seconds) and a much longer one in the audio (about 2 seconds). I was able to connect from outside my home network to the camera without needing to configure anything on my home router. In fact, I had the camera connected to a wireless router, that's connected to another wireless router (two layers of NAT), both with uPNP and port forwarding disabled. This suggests that the camera is connecting to Belkin's servers instead of the other way around.Power consumption : I measured this with a Kill-a-Watt. Power consumption is very low. I measured it at 2W when the IR is off, and 3W when IR is on. Changing frame rate, picture quality, and other parameters didn't affect power consumption in any way that can be measured by the Kill-a-Watt. I left it on for 24 hours and it reported a total energy consumption of 0.05 kWh. Assuming IR is left on auto, this device will consume under 2 kWh in a month - less than 50 cents for the typical user.The power plug can take 100-240V @ 50-60Hz. The output is 5V 1.5A.So, again, in summary - has great image quality (640 x 480), has sound, really easy to set up, it just works without having to configure anything with your home router, but the password is stored at Belkin's server.

} } } Length:: 0:23 MinsI've had a Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera since May 2012 and I've been mostly happy with it, but with two reservations. Most importantly, the picture is dull, with most of the color bleached out, which means that it's not only less pleasant to look at, but less useful than it could be. I've had it pointed at my front porch and, for example, cannot tell whether the red flag on the mailbox is up or not because the red blends in with the green bushes behind it. (Notice that in the attached video you can see the red flag just fine!) Second, the email alerts are not that helpful, for two reasons. First, they're so sensitive that I receive notices when cars go by, which I don't really care about. Second, last I checked with Dropcam, the alerts only go out once every half hour. So if someone comes to your door between one alert and the next, you're not notified by email.With that background, I got my hands on a Belkin NetCam. I was delighted by it immediately. Here's what I like about it:1. The setup was absolutely simple. No problems whatever. I had it running in minutes.2. The picture is BRIGHT. Far brighter than what I get with the Dropcam. I've added two images to this item to show the differences between the two.3. You can take pictures or video of what the camera is seeing on the fly. The video attached to this review was taken that way with the microphone off at 640 x 480, with a frame rate of 15 (out of a possible 30) and a quality of 5 (out f 5).4. You can choose to receive email alerts when the device detects motion. Unlike the Dropcam, there is no thirty-minute delay, so when the camera detects motion, you get an email. This is a good thing. The other thing I like about the email alerts is that they include two pictures rather than one. Very often with the Dropcam, which sends one picture, you get a photo when something has just entered the area being monitored, and you can barely tell what it is. With two pictures, you get that first image and the a second one, when whatever has entered the area farther into the frame. The result is a much more informative alert.What could be improved:1. As for negatives, the only real downside of the device for me also has to do with the email alerts. You can adjust the sensitivity of the motion detection with settings from 1-5. What I'd like is to receive alerts whenever someone comes to my door or is in the front yard, say, some 15 feet from the camera. But none of the settings give me that. A setting of 1 seems to result in no alerts coming in at all. But settings from 2-5 result in my getting alerts for cars driving by. Admittedly, sometimes I seem to get fewer alerts about passing cars than other times, and I'm not sure yet what the pattern is. Certainly all settings from 2-5 have alerted me about traffic in front of the house at one time or another. Hopefully the gradations of motion sensitivity for the alerts can be improved in software updates--I'm not sure if that's possible, however.2. There is no Kindle Fire app (yet?).3. The NetCam does not allow you to talk through the device as the Dropcam does. (That is, using the Dropcam you can talk to people in the room from some external site). But this isn't a feature I care about, but some may.On the whole, highly recommended!-- Debra Hamel

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Puijoe
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple camera for home security purpose, I am a simple user, I just want something easy to set up and easy to use.This Camera fits the bill. Originally, I was having a problem in set up. Came to find out, It was due to the slowness of my DSL, (you got what you pay for in sellecting Verizon). After a few click to adjust the resolution, it worked fine.I have tested it for two days, day and night, both works really well. I only want to take a look a look at my home and see if my kids are okay, This satifies my need. I am not looking for a 24/7 security system, but something that I can click on my cell phone and instantly checking on my kids and make sure they are okay.The wide angle pretty much covers my living room when I place the camera at the corner, which by the way blends well with my fixtures. Nothing sticks out like a sore thumb.Night visions works well as it continues to allow me to check up on my kids while I am driving home and got stuck in the freeway. It is this peace of mind that I was looking for and this simple camera gives me just that.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: ann marie kubiszak
Reviews.Content: This is a great product! I received this camera as a gift after my VERY expensive Summer baby monitor quit working. I needed a product that was easy to use, had good picture quality, and had an audio feed. This product does all of that, and moreover, does it really well. While I realize that I am not using this camera as it is intended, it is fantastic. Set up is a snap and the app for my iphone has been great. Once in a while it's slow or crashes, but it has not been a big deal. The picture quality is great despite that the room is pitch dark at night and I can see almost the entire bedroom as well. We have also had no issues with this product when using an ipad. Both ipads and iphones have worked very well with this product. If you are going to use this as a baby monitor it is important to note that if you want to watch/hear your baby all night long or for the duration of nap time, this is not the product for you. It will allow you to see/hear for about a 15 minute window and then shut down if you do not click on the screen and say you're still watching. Despite that, it's still fantastic and I don't ever go anywhere without it! LOVE this camera!

Reviews.Title: Worst product ever
Reviews.Author: AACP
Reviews.Content: The worst, most unreliable product ever purchased from Amazon. One day it works, the next it doesn't. Purchased this to watch the house when traveling. Seems you have to constantly reboot the camera by unplugging it them plugging it in. Little tough to do when you are 500 mikes away. Phone support non existent. Do not buy this product !..Ever !!

Reviews.Title: Riddle me this Belkin
Reviews.Author: AMerint
Reviews.Content: The NetCam (F7D7601) is a rebranded ImogenStudio +Cam that retails for 50.00 less. The +Cam is also available on Amazon. The ImogenStudio +Cam has the same features and an additional cloud service powered by seedonk with more features. The additional features provided by the ImogenStudio +Cam include network DVR storage and additional notification settings. Buy purchasing this camera I paid the price for the Belkin brand.ImogenStudio +Cam - Wireless Network Camera for iPhone and Android

Reviews.Title: Lots of trouble I can't recommend
Reviews.Author: Joseph Spiegel "Joe"
Reviews.Content: Belkin NetCam Wireless IP Camera for Tablet and Smartphone with Night Vision and Digital AudioI was so looking forward to testing out this Netcam. I have been eyeing different models and manufacturers but the opportunity to test this one made my choice easy. It is at best a mixed bag at worst a useless device.First the setup, It is very simple to set up. After removing it from the box, there is a quick setup guide that walks you through the procedure. Essentially you download the appropriate app, I have iOS devices. Then plug it in and set the switch on the back of the camera to the top position. This broadcasts a Wi-Fi name that you can log onto from your iPad/iPhone in the Settings App, not the Belkin App. You can then make your configurations, create or login to your Belkin Netcam account and when done, press the switch into the operational mode. After this is done you put your device back onto your home Wi-Fi or cell service. You can now run the Belkin app and see your camera in action. Action, yeah, that's a word. I have 2MB up speed on my Internet connection, that's 2-3 times an average up speed. Still, the best I can get is bumpy or freezing video. It is very frustrating. I started playing with the settings for the camera and I could not find a happy medium. I also couldn't stop the eventual freezing. I also found the sound pretty much useless as all I got was a loud "hooting" sound. This was all from the app, both on the iPad (in stretch mode) and the iPhone 5 on local wifi or AT&T; LTE.I then logged into the Belkin Netcam web site. It proved to be better than the app but I still had problems. When the light was good I got a decent if bumpy image. If the light was dim but not dark colors and clarity suffered. In darkness the red LEDs kick on and the infra-red takes over. The image is a black and white and looks like a 7-11 spy cam. It's cool but has the same problems as above.I checked for a firmware update and I am up to date on the camera. The app needs an update as I think most of the issues stem from there. It all really needs updating. When both get updated I'll try to run it again and will update this review. Until then, I can't recommend it. It's just unusable.

Reviews.Title: Easy!!!
Reviews.Author: IamAbel "IamAbel"
Reviews.Content: Easy set up! Have not had a problem with it and finished by buying another one for my son! Will probably buy yet another one

Reviews.Title: Not a Reliable Technology
Reviews.Author: Do'Glas "MegaConsumer"
Reviews.Content: This is great in concept, but the technology isn't stable.  It's hard to keep a reliable connection, especially on Android operating systems.  The web site crashes frequently.  Customer service couldn't get much worse.  All in all it's a complete failure and I wouldn't be surprised if there was a class action lawsuit to return peoples money.  This thing is a lemon.  What happened to lemon laws designed to protect consumers from crappy products such as this?

Reviews.Title: Worked for a few days then crapped out
Reviews.Author: Arthur Moreno
Reviews.Content: I did not hook it up right away after receiving it and now it is too late to return it.  I lost $$

Reviews.Title: Good picture, easy to use and easy to HACK!!!  Not secure!
Reviews.Author: The Smiths
Reviews.Content: I would have given the camera a 4 due to the price and quality of the camera, which is awesome! Comparing the features and picture to my friends, this camera is better than many others. What I do not like us the inability to secure the camera??????? Though the supporting app is password protected (I chose a super difficult one), someone was able to hack into it. I really appreciate the immediate notification on my iPad, but had I not been on it I would not have known. My kids play in the room with the camera, so that really scared me. We've since disconnected the camera in our upstairs bonus room. That's why I am giving it a 3 with a warning!

Reviews.Title: Belkin Experience
Reviews.Author: Ben Mannweiler
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 cameras. One worked, but the second one would not connect. I called Belkin and waited about 30 minutes and then I was told that I would be transferred to a technician. This took another 30 minutes and after speaking to two different so called techs and 6 HOURS yes 6, I was told to return the camera which I did. I returned both cameras and a Belkin router. Belkin and their service are crap!!!

Reviews.Title: Security disaster
Reviews.Author: Johannes Ernst
Reviews.Content: Open like a barn door when it arrived. Anybody with a browser could access the video 24x7. Unchangeable username/password combination of admin/admin. Filed a security report with Belkin, and sent the device back immediately.Also, it appears this is a third-party device only branded by Belkin. The third party has access to the video when using the iPhone app. This is not disclosed anywhere in the documentation.

Reviews.Title: Simple & easy to use
Reviews.Author: iCastle
Reviews.Content: I really like this device, product.  It's easy to setup as instructions state. I use it for my apartment home. The best feature, email alert. Just a slight problem with email alerts. When window blinds are open sunlight,  glares from the street, moving cars etc. trigger motion sensor and I would receive emails every 10-15 min. I now keep blinds close and it seems to be helping.  They are white so light still shines through and it does seem to be working. Overall picture quality is pretty good as well. However, night vision not as great as I would expect. Not an issue since I also have the Belkin WeMo light switches and can turn lights on if motion detected. WeMo app works well with NetCam app too. Did I mention audio? Not a bad feature. Plus, you can record. All in all it's a good surveillance cam for the price. Compared to the Drop Cam, which I did look at and wanted but $200 way too much money to invest for my needs. Honestly,  the only difference between the 2 ? HD and two-way audio, which the Belkin lacks, but hey it's $100 less and works perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: poor support from company
Reviews.Author: bud
Reviews.Content: techs on phone cannot be clearly understood and was disconnected twice.  given wrong information.  the unit I received was defective(black irregular shape in middle of screen)  In addition the cloud service that comes with a 30 day free trial tells you it will be available for purchase but the company has no idea what the fee will be per month or when they will start charging.  It really shouldn't be sold until they resolve this issue. I asked about other android compatible software and was told it may or may not work.  nuff said

Reviews.Title: Threw it in the garbage!
Reviews.Author: Joe  Koehler
Reviews.Content: The camera part works O.K. The problem was; I could not turn off the email alerts. Once you turn it on, expect it to stay on for life.I didn't need the email alert on while I was home.  I'd get a new alert every 15 seconds(whenever it detected motion). So aggravating! Then I tried going to my account on my PC,Thought maybe I could turn it off there. Couldn't log on. So, So Aggravating!! I thought maybe I forgot my password. Changed that. Still could not log in So Very Aggravating!!!!IN THE GARBAGE IT WENT!  WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING FROM BELKIN AGAIN!Would strongly advise anybody NOT to buy the Belkin Netcam

Reviews.Title: Easy, affordable, works
Reviews.Author: Aqiylah Collins
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I didn't do any research and purchased the NetCam solely based on Belkin's reputation.I gave this product 4 stars for:Setup - the camera and app were extremely easy to set up ... 20 minutes start to finish (a few YouTube videos helped to clarify)Video - clear, timely, accurate - including the Night VisionFunction - works well, just as described ... both in the house and away from homeWould have given 5 stars if instructions were a little more detailed for clarity.I'm using the NetCam to monitor a parent with dementia, especially at night ... thinking this could also be useful for monitoring someone who is hospitalized, in a nursing home, rehab facility (using their wifi), left at home alone or with a caregiver.Compared to similar devices, I find the price is good, especially for the functionality.

Reviews.Title: Solid product and great tech support
Reviews.Author: L. Pirolli
Reviews.Content: These cameras set up easily and transmit good quality video and audio.  At one point I had trouble getting a video feed off of one of my cameras so I emailed tech support. I got very useful tech support (it turned out to be a simple Settings issue) within a few hours which will prevent any future crash.  I like these cameras because they are really user-friendly and relatively inexpensive (so you can afford to use a bunch), but most importantly, when I needed help, someone got back to me with real help right away.

Reviews.Title: "App" Cam / Not Exactly an "IP Cam"
Reviews.Author: F. Verdi "The Philadelphia Kid"
Reviews.Content: My problem with this camera is that it is an "app"-based camera, and for some reason you can NOT easily access it via firmware, as you traditionally would with a typical Wi-Fi camera, and so I haven't been able to integrate it with the rest of my network. I suppose it would work fine in a single-camera/cloud operation, using an iPad or an Android device, but if you want something to integrate with your existing network or DVR you're going to want to go with D-Link or another similar line of IP cameras.

Reviews.Title: Belkin IP Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Vincent Calderon
Reviews.Content: Easy install camera. All you need is a smartphone, wi-fi connection at the location the camera is placed and an outlet. In terms of  the camera it goes in an out from color to black & white frequently. I've run into issues of not being able to connect or getting bounced from the app. The audio feature is just ok. I've had 50/50 image quality. Overall its a good camera to check in on a pet or keep an eye on things occasionally.

Reviews.Title: Buy another one...
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a few months.  It worked great for a few days then it suddenly freezes which I dont mind happening on occassions but had been happening every other day now.  I have this set up in the baby's room to monitor if my son is up and crying.  A few times, it would give me a delayed picture assuming he was still asleep but he's been up for quite some time.  I notified the help/support but they were unable to help. I have to unplugging back and forth to reset it.

Reviews.Title: Belkin camera are HORRIBLE !
Reviews.Author: Dan Green
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 belkin cameras ...3 from Amazon and 1 from Belkin. Don't waste your money !!! I is not worth $5.00Dan Green

Reviews.Title: Very good camera or the price
Reviews.Author: Banquero
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd IP camera I tried (the 1st was a HooToo). This one was much better than the other brand, setup was a breeze. You just connect it to your network, download the netcam app, link it to your netcam account, and change it to operational mode and your good to go!It has night vision. There is audio (not great but adequate). You can view on a phone/tablet using the netcam app (ios/android) or you can view on a computer on a netcam website. you can set it up to email you if motion is detected and you can change the sensitivity for the motion detection. I once had it too sensitive and it sent me about 30 emails as a shadow moved across the wall as the sun began to set, so I had to turn it down!I live in an apartment and occasionally the maintenance guy has to enter for one reason or another, and I suspected that they may be going in places that they have no business being. So I got this camera, set it up and caught a maintenance guy looking in my fridge! He had no business being in the kitchen at all! I had set the camera up to email me if motion was detected, I got the email with 2 screenshots it takes automatically when motion is detected. I then logged into the netcam app, and watched the guy live, I took screenshots and recorded some video using the app to prove to the leasing office what this guy was doing. Another time when I got my windows replaced I watched the workers to make sure nothing was amiss while they were in my apartment ( other than talking about how nice my TV was no problems there!).I give this 4 stars instead of 5 only because there are better devices out there. They may not be as simple as this one but hardware wise there are more advanced options available. The 1st device I tried actually swiveled to look at the source of the noise. The Belkin also doesn't give you a smooth video, its a little choppy. but your not watching a movie here, as a security cam it gets the job done. I love it, I even bought a 2nd one to use in another room,

Reviews.Title: Worst product ever !
Reviews.Author: jackwfire
Reviews.Content: The worst, most unreliable product ever purchased from Amazon. One day it works, the next it doesn't. Purchased this to watch the house when traveling. Seems you have to constantly reboot the camera by unplugging it them plugging it in. Little tough to do when you are 500 mikes away. Phone support non existent. Do not buy this product !..Ever !!

Reviews.Title: This camera works fine... until after a few weeks! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: My Belkin Netcam was working great until after a few weeks. It now only works if I'm connected to my home wi-fi network, but if I'm not home, it won't connect. BELKIN SUPPORT IS HORRIBLE! There is no number you can call for support. Only support is online and they only reply to your questions whenever they feel like it. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: Trying to use in shop but won't work that distance
Reviews.Author: Karen Cress
Reviews.Content: It's ok if I just use in the house but I was hoping to use to watch puppies in shop but signal won't work the distance.

Reviews.Title: do NOT buy Belkin netcam
Reviews.Author: pacomartinez
Reviews.Content: Here is the ONE and ONLY reason:"It crashes every few hours and has to be rebooted...."WHAT kind of non-sense is this??= unacceptable.I'm looking to put a night vision / remote security camera / w 2 way talkingon my property in Oro Grande, CA.We got burglarized on07/02/2010 for $24,500.With a proper system, I can get notices if there is motion, video recorded,and viewed on my laptop, tablet or smart phone.Don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Oscar Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I have an Iphone 5 and was looking for a simple way to check up on my home when no ones home. This was the perfect solution.As soon as I got the camera I placed it a corner of house, it's small enough that it's easy to conceal on a book shelf or dresser etc. I downloaded the Belkin app on my phone and within minutes I had it set up.Whenever we're away from the home I enable the email alert settings, the system automatically takes photos and sends them to your email upon sensing motion. The photos are clear and the email is received reasonably fast.Overall I recommend this camera to anyone who doesn't want to spend hundreds of dollars on a system.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfect with minor anoyance
Reviews.Author: Steve Donato "sailor.in.florida"
Reviews.Content: Documentation does not tell you you have to download the Belkin NetCam app. on your tablet or smartphone to do the setup. The video is a bit jiggly but quite acceptable. Can click a button while watching the video to get sound, video record or take a snapshot picture.Cannot use your laptop/PC to view the video cam (no windows driver)only tablet or smartphone, android or apple ios App supplied in the Google store or iPhone store (free app.)  I give it a 4.9 because documentation lacking and, the login screen automatically switches to portriat mode, but the cam video viewing switches to landscape for viewing.I'm using a Samsung Tablet Note, 10.1 with android 4.1 (which I also bought from Amazon) using WiFi only. Using it one day (so far so good) to keep an eye on hired help.Only the Belkin website mentions the fact that App must be downloaded.Functionally this cam will;"  Support night vision for sight even in the dark  Wide-angle video for larger spaces  Easy mobile setup eliminates the need for a computer to connect  Movement-detection notifications sent via email  Save live video directly to your mobile device  Digital audio for crystal-clear sound  Works with the free NetCam app; no subscription service needed  Requires a Wi-Fi router and Internet connection  Compatible with iOS 4.2 and up as well as Android 2.2 and up"

Reviews.Title: Not so good a product to say the least - able to return it
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: I, unfortunately, bought two Belkin cams...one for the beach house and one for home. Fortunately, I was able to return both. Wasted two evenings talking to the Belkin support (if that's what you want to call them...Philippines based). When camera loses connection, from what I can gather, you have to reset it and must be at the location...unable to do it remotely. When camera is 300+ miles away, it's a little tough. What a piece of garbage!!!! Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: netcam is not a good buy
Reviews.Author: judy
Reviews.Content: Purchased an belkin Netcam in may 2013 along with a friend____Terrible _should not b sold!!!don't waste your money! Hard to get support because they need to fix bug!

Reviews.Title: No app for iPad.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: There isn't an app for the iPad.  I was excited to see something but it has to be viewed on my tiny iPhone.  They should tell you that.

Reviews.Title: camera is great but the software doesn't deliver on promises
Reviews.Author: Swati
Reviews.Content: The quality of audio and video is very good. But the software keeps hanging, sharing with others dosen't work. The email doesn't get delivered. More promises than delivery.

Reviews.Title: Had to send it back
Reviews.Author: R. Scott
Reviews.Content: I don't think it was an issue with the camera but more likely with the app on my iPhone5. If I let the camera sit without viewing it for more than a few minutes I could not access it again without going through through the set up process. Given that, this camera would not suit my needs so I returned it.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Michael Wray
Reviews.Content: We use this at work for remote monitoring, and for the price, it's done pretty much as we expected it to do. Not the best picture ever, but very useful!

Reviews.Title: We're using it to monitor the back yard for nighttime visitors
Reviews.Author: Gavin Scott
Reviews.Content: Having just moved to a new suburban home near Chicago, we have discovered that we get a wide variety of interesting wildlife visiting in the evening/night. Striped Skunks, Bunnies, Raccoons, etc. I have the camera set up in a window of the garage watching the gate on the back fence that these critters seem to sneak under (or over) and we're going to see if we can capture some good night-vision shots.I will report back and post some images if we're successful!G.

Reviews.Title: Belkin NetCam
Reviews.Author: J. Amicucci
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to setup. You plug it in, connect to your wifi, and you are good to go. You can also download the app for your smartphone.Once up and running, I had no issues - I could inside my house and easily checkout what was going on there which is great to do if you are away from home often or have pets / children you need to keep an eye on.  The images are not great, but it is certainly satisfactory to monitor your home.Probably one of the easier cameras to setup. A good value and a good buy, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Kit
Reviews.Content: I bought it to watch my pets and it does the job. Easy to set up. I just wish that it I could move the camera remotely.  But other than that, it does what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: unable to put this device to use.
Reviews.Author: William A. Bacon "Ufo researcher"
Reviews.Content: I hated this item because I could not find a way to use it. When you register online you are supposed to to be assigned a username. This username is required before you can use it, However, I spent about 3 hours over two days LOOKING FOR MY USERNAME. I could not obtain it, so I returned it as unusable

Reviews.Title: It's Just OKAY
Reviews.Author: Donia
Reviews.Content: I wish it was in black as the white stands out like a sore thumb.  The video this takes is shaky and you can't even see the persons face clearly.  The pictures come out great; but the video is not great.  Also, the night vision is poor.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Y. Kim "Zelium"
Reviews.Content: The Belkin NetCam Wireless could have been the best IP camera I have used.  It looked nice and the finish was top-notch.  It came from Belkin who knows well about computer accessories and miscellaneous gadgets.  The Belkin NetCam Wireless does not need a computer and the setup was super easy using my smartphone, Galaxy Note 2.  It was up and running within 2 minutes after I opened the box.  The night vision feature was superb and the audio support was also great.  The motion detection alert by email was a feature that I cannot miss.  The quality of picture is decent and the app, Netcam worked flawlessly on both of my android phone and iPad.However, the major problem of the Belkin NetCam Wireless was that the connection was very shaky.  I was not very successful connecting to the Belkin NetCam Wireless from outside.  Almost half of the time I tried by using many different Wifi environments, I couldn't establish a connection.  What kind of a wireless IP camera is useful if I can get any video or picture from it from outside?I hope that Belkin updates the firmware soon so that I can really use it reliably.  Then it'll get all the stars I can give.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, Inconsistent Performance.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: While other have found this easy to set up, it took me a LONG time to get it working and connected.  I am a techie so I have an idea of what I need to do.Once it got connected, I was absolutely amazed at the picture quality.  Excellent colors and quality on my iPhone and iPad.That being said, you can't enjoy such excellent quality if you can't get an image loaded.  My experience over many days of trying to view this camera on my iPhone and iPad was horribly inconsistent.  Rarely could I get it to load.  In fact, when I went to the Belkin website a number of times to view this camera I was never able to do so.So, while the camera image quality is excellent, it doesn't do you any good if you can't load the image and depend on it when you need it most.Thus, two stars knocked off for these performance issues.  A major disappointment in an otherwise excellent image quality product.My two cents.

Reviews.Title: Basic, easy to setup, low on features
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I found the instructions to setup easy to fallow.Pro:Camera has night visionCamera has micEasy to Setup, requires Smart Phone to setupCan view camera using smart phone over local networkCan view camera over the internet using smart phone or computer (frame rate low over the internet)includes wall mountCamera power by wall plugconnects to network by ethernet or wifi.Can manual record video/audio using smart phoneCons:Motion detection is only still frame to email (no auto video recording)Motion recording has no time frame (like only email me motion if it's a time I would normally not be at home)can not access camera via LAN web interfacecan not setup camera using computer, must have smart phonecamera dose not support  IP based streaming video standards.Not a 'hidden' cameraNot water proofNo Pan/Tilt.No built-in battery backup (camera doesn't work in power outage)No offline recording (internet drops out, camera dose not record motion)Web Interface passes passwords over the internet using plane text.view only one camera at a time

Reviews.Title: Fun Gadget But Inconsistent Performance
Reviews.Author: Bobbewig
Reviews.Content: As a techniphobe I was a little afraid of this wireless netcam, but it turned out to be easy to set up for my iphone.  Unfortunately it is very inconsistent in its operation.  I really set it up to watch my dog when he is alone (he mostly just sleeps!) and I have been able to access the video about 50% of the times I have tried.  I keep getting a message about "limited bandwidth" but I am in the same place and it works on and off.  Also the instructions are really very sparse.When it does work, the picture is pretty good and the camera covers a fairly wide area.  I think its overpriced at $100 and needs a lot of improvement.

Reviews.Title: It really didn't work very well for me
Reviews.Author: Kristi "all my facts come from fiction"
Reviews.Content: This little "wireless" (wifi for network connectivity but you have to plug it into power) netcam takes a rather unusual approach to setup... you HAVE to have an IOS or Android wifi device in order to initially set up the camera.  The set up  instructions are perhaps too simple... an 8-page, 2-sided accordion-fold piece, each "page" about the size of an index card.  The first page says to plug the camera in and put a switch into the setup mode.  The next three pages are for IOS setup, the next three for Android:  Use your wifi device to connect to the camera's wifi, download the Netcam app to your device, launch the app to give the camera its user name and password.  The last page tells you to flip the switch OUT of setup.  The back side of the accordion set tells you how to mount the camera with screws, has the FCC etc. and has a small statement about how to view the camera from an internet computer.I was able to get through the setup without any problems, although the camera warned that it wasn't getting a very strong wifi signal.  Now, all the *other* wifi devices seemed to be doing fine in that spot, and nowhere that I moved it seemed to help.  I don't think it has a very strong wifi antenna.The directions *don't* tell you that to configure things like the frames per second, the rotation rate, the infrared, etc. you really do appear to need to go to the website and log in -- at least, I can't find any spot to adjust these settings on the Android app.  From the website you can also set up email for motion detection, with a slider for sensitivity.  I have set the sensitivity as low as possible and danced in front of this camera and have, as yet, received no notifications, nor does there appear to be a log to check activity without getting emails.  (Later note:  Once I turned off all the lights to try the infra-red, I *did* get an email... then, email detection continued to work for several hours.  Then I changed the "to" email address, and it stopped working again. <shrug>)You can remotely configure the camera to rotate, but can't set its rotation angle from the computer, i.e. you can say "move back and forth," but you can't cause it to move a few degrees to the left and then stop there.  You can't adjust the "up and down" dimension remotely at all.I am consistently able to use the Android app to view the camera feed, at least for the couple of minutes that it allows before it goes inactive and tells you to log in again if you wish to continue viewing.  I am consistently unable to use the internet login to view the camera feed.  At first, I thought this was a bandwidth issue connecting my home to the internet, but that appears to not be the case -- the website feed just doesn't work, at least with either Chrome or IE browsers.The rectangular camera sits up on a rather slender stem on a small pedestal.  A simple ring screw untightens to allow you to change the angle of the camera on a little ball joint with relation to its stem, then tighten the ring to fix it into place.The infrared lights seem quite dim when on in the dark, but do an effective job -- objects 10-12 feet away are quite clear.My bottom line is this -- the big strength of this camera is the simplicity of setting it up to be seen remotely, from your Android or IOS device, or (hopefully, for those with faster bandwidth) from the internet.  On my other wireless webcam, you have to do some moderately-sophisticated router tweaking to configure things so you can see the feed from outside your local home network, and there is only a website interface, no mobile device app.On the other hand, my other wireless webcam is more full-featured, and works better.  I can log into it and see its feed using devices larger than my phone AND I can leave the feed up indefinitely; I can rotate it sideways and up and down remotely; it keeps a log of motion events and will record still shots or video for me to go look at, or they are freely emailed to me; it is short and squat like R2D2 and so very stable. That camera also generally retails for less.I'm a big fan of wireless cameras as opposed to those that have to be connected to the "base" with a video cable, but this Belkin Webcam camera is not the one that will come first in my toolbox.

Reviews.Title: Watching my cats
Reviews.Author: G. Ware Cornell Jr. "anotherlawyer"
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my office and watching several of my cats who are at home. This is a feature my wife wanted badly, as well as the ability to monitor for intruders.This netcam does both well. It has a wide angle, night vision and motion detection. A cool feature is that the motion detector will send you an email when the cats or the burglars come into the field of vision. From that point it is a simple matter to snap a picture of the screen from your iOS or Android device or even record a video of the kitties or crooks in action.Setup took less than five minutes including the time to find and install the free iPhone app. Additional cameras can be easily added if you want to monitor different zones.This is a an excellent choice for those seeking to add stealth to their pet watching or burglar catching.

Reviews.Title: READ THIS PLEASE
Reviews.Author: Alexander Zinner
Reviews.Content: The camera works, their app works. Setup is easy. Night image somewhat poorer than others.Thats the good part of the review.Camera will not be usable directly connected to anything in your home network.This feature was in the camera but a firmware update killed it.Their app times out a LOT after 5 minutes or less of streaming.If you need direct connection or ability to monitor this camera longer than 5 minutes, Then this camera is not for you.If you peek a little now and then at the image and dont want to mess around with ports DNS ect, then you could use this.For me, I need continuous viewing and this camera could do it till their firmware update killed direct connection.Their customer service give platitudes but nothing is being done or will be done to correct this.I personally will never by a Belkin product again after this.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time - Learn from my mistake
Reviews.Author: matthew keperling
Reviews.Content: I have used Belkin products in the past and had great success.  When I came across this for our baby monitor, I found TERRIBLE reviews, but against my better judgement, I decided to give it a try.  This camera uses a cloud server and does not give the option to connect strictly through the LAN, so your video is being bounced off a remote server even though you and the camera are in the same house.  It would rarely work and when it would, it would take up to 30 seconds to connect.  I returned this, went to Office Depot and bought the D-Link DCS-932L which uses cloud AND local connection, so when you are in the home with the camera, it connects instantly.  Even better, it's cheaper.Learn from my mistake and stay away from this.

Reviews.Title: Can't log into app
Reviews.Author: xthred
Reviews.Content: Can't log into iPhone app.  Created Belkin account.  To log into belkin.com I use email & password.  To log into NetCam App on iPhone it asks for "user name" & password.  Can't figure out user name.  Tried every combination I can think of.  Belkin has no customer support.  Will return the camera tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Stay Away!
Reviews.Author: Anna Hope
Reviews.Content: Stay away!1.This is a rebadged ImogenStudio +Cam which retails for ~$30 less.2.After 3 days of use the device would not connect to my network - countless factory resets and soft resets did nothing3.I called Belkin support (offshore) and got a scripted response. After the 3rd factory reset and 2 hours on the phone the device starts working - great you say.... 5 minutes after I get off the phone it stops working again.4.Hard wired ethernet did not resolve this problemNow when it did work1.Picture quality is mediocre at best. I used it, for the 3 days it worked, to monitor my dog in the yard and the output was basic quality.2.Frame rate can be adjustable based on your bandwidth and need3.Picture is quite delayed on both wifi and 3\4g connections - comparing a couple of units. Nexia device and a custom synology diskstation surveillance unit were seconds ahead.4.Setup was simple - the device creates its own wifi network you then connect to that network with your idevice or android device and provide it with you SSID and password for your network and you should be configured.5.Alerts sensitivity did not work well.6.Cannot connect directly to the device, you have to rely on Belkin for the connection.7.Night vision was not very good quality but would suffice.In all good conscience I cannot recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: unable to see
Reviews.Author: zachary d jones
Reviews.Content: I am unable to see video on my cell phone network... if I'm connected to WiFi I can see it with no problem, but when on my cell phone network and all the settings turned to lowest quality I still am unable to view the video, to be honest, my cell phone internet is actually faster than my home internet, not by much but is faster.

Reviews.Title: Simple setup, poor feature set, connection problems
Reviews.Author: N. Krumpe
Reviews.Content: *** UPDATE to original review ***After another day of using this camera, I am lowering my rating from 4 stars to 1 star.  Three reasons for the downgrade:1) Unreliable streaming: I relocated the camera to another room in the house, which meant unplugging the power and restarting the camera.  After that, I was unable to get video...not from the app, and not from Belkin's website.  I could access the camera and change its configuration, but I couldn't get video from it (despite the fact that the indicator lights on the back of it told me that it was connected).  So, I unplugged it and plugged it back in.  Minutes later, I could access the video again, both from the website and the app.2) Lack of a dedicated iPad app.  Apparently, the only way to run the NetCam app on the iPad is to run the iPhone app in full screen mode.  This isn't a huge deal, but if you are going to market a camera as being designed to use with tablets, then a tablet-specific app seems appropriate.3) Support forums show general dissatisfaction.  Search the web for Belkin NetCam Community Support and you will observe that people are running into connection problems, and the only response from Belkin seems to be "Here's a link to the installation manual".I'm going to keep an eye out for a firmware update to the camera.  Perhaps that will resolve the unreliable streaming problem.  For now, though, I have a hard time recommending this camera until issue 1, above, is resolved.*** END UPDATE ***Understand that this wi-fi camera is very specifically meant to work hand-in-hand with an iOS or Android device.  In fact, the short set of instructions only walk you through setting up the camera by using Belkin's freely available "NetCam" app.  (Once setup, you can also access it through Belkin's website.)  In that regard, setup was extremely simple.  I sat in my living room, plugged in the camera's power adapter, downloaded the app to my iPhone, and in just a couple minutes, the camera was streaming to the phone.  Belkin advertises that "setup is a breeze", and I couldn't agree more.So, if ease of setup is your number one priority (and if you plan to use this with a smartphone or tablet), then I can easily recommend this camera.  And, the mobile app is very easy to use, and even allows for some basic configuring of the camera.  However...This Belkin camera lacks a LOT of functionality that can be found in similarly priced IP cameras.  By contrast, I recently purchased the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black), which is roughly the same cost as this Belkin NetCam (sometimes even less expensive).  Here's a list of features found in the Foscam that are NOT found in the Belkin:* Pan/Tilt/Zoom allows you to see much more of a room than the stationary Belkin* Upload images to an FTP server OR send images by e-mail (Belkin only allows e-mail)* Access the camera in a web browser with its own unique URL (by contrast, Belkin requires that you sign up for a free account with them, and log in to their website to access your camera)* Two-way audio communication (that is, you can use the camera to talk to and listen to someone remotely, while this NetCam only allows you to listen)* Highly configurable through a web interface (the Belkin can only be configured through the app or the Belkin website)The Foscam and Belkin also have several features in common.  Both have night vision, both work over wi-fi, and both can be set up to send e-mail if motion is detected.  I will say that the Belkin has a slightly wider field of vision (you can see more of a room with the Belkin than with the Foscam if both cameras are stationary), but the ability to remotely rotate the Foscam means that you actually can see much more of the room with the Foscam.In other words, my Foscam can basically do all the things the Belkin can do, plus a whole lot more.  BUT, the Foscam is not nearly as easy to set up as the Belkin.  And, while the Foscam is accessible through a web browser, and by many third-party iOS and Android apps, the Foscam lacks a dedicated app.So, if you are in the market for an IP camera that is easy to get up and running and you need an easy way to monitor a room in your house, the Belkin NetCam may be the way to go.  If you are nervous about things like "router configuration" and "dynamic DNS", the Belkin camera protects you from all that.However, if you are willing to put a little extra effort into setting up your camera, the rewards of a pan/tilt/zoom IP camera such as the Foscam far outweigh the initial work involved.  As for me, I really prefer more advanced features over ease of setup.  The lack of extra features in the Belkin is my reason for rating it 4 stars rather than 5.

Reviews.Title: False Advertising
Reviews.Author: Boriqua2000
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera to keep an eye on my kids when they get home from school and to watch my house when im at work.the camera constanly freezes.it says that you can record video but after about 10 seconds the app crashes when you try to record.it also says that it will send you email alerts when it senses movement but ive never gotten an email when my kids get home to tell me that there is movement in my house even though i have the settings set at the most sensitive.i was going to buy a few of these cameras to put around my house in various rooms but decided to buy one only to see how it works.im glad i did.i would not recommend this product.i was also thinking of buying Dropcam but purchased this instead because of the recording feature.waste of money because that feature doesn't even work.Flase Advertising all the way.

Reviews.Title: As good as I expected.
Reviews.Author: R. Helmig
Reviews.Content: I just bought one of these and did not have any trouble with the set up or anything else.  The one thing I did have to do was turn off the email notification option while we're still playing with it and trying to decide where to locate it.  I could probably have played with the sensitivity and been fine leaving it on.  I'll turn it on again when we're out of town.  The IR works perfectly even at night with all the house lights off.  Video is fine, photos are fine, sound is a little too sensitive but I don't have an issue with it.  I don't know if using the app on an iPhone makes our experience any beter that some others, but I can't find anything to grump about!!

Reviews.Title: This camera is worthless and so is the customer support
Reviews.Author: Eric Borchardt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a local store so we could set it up in my daughter's room as a monitor. We had just converted her crib into a toddler bed and wanted to be able to check in on her without opening the door. I saw this camera on the shelf and thought it would be perfect since I could check the camera from my phone without having to be at a computer. I brought the camera home and followed the setup instructions, which is an easy process. I had the camera up and running in less than 10 minutes. Then I waited until we put my daughter to bed and went to log onto the camera, but the website said my camera was offline. I thought to myself, that's weird and I went and unplugged the camera for about 20 seconds and plugged it back in. My daughter was very curious at this point, since I had to go back into her room to do this. After this, the camera worked for about another 2 hours when I had to repeat this process. The camera does this every night, and there doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to it.The customer service is provided through the GetSatisfaction.com portal. You can check it out yourself at:[...]. I saw several other questions similar to mine, all of which have been unanswered for at least a month. I looked through all the other questions, and I can't seem to find a helpful answer to any of the questions in the entire community. I guess Belkin is not providing support for this camera any longer, so if you have problems you are on your own.Pros:-Easy to set up-Free app available for both iOS and Android-You can watch your camera from anywhere there is internet (as long as your camera hasn't crashed)Cons-Camera is very unstable. It crashes every few hours requiring a reboot which can only be done by unplugging the camera and plugging it back in.-Lack of an auto-record feature-You can only view the camera through the Belkin website. This is irritating because there is so much lag on the video and I should be able to connect directly to the camera since it's on my network.-The Belkin website is not secure, your login credentials are passed in clear text to another company called Seedonk.com (Seedonk is apparently the actual maker of this product, which is rebranded as a Belkin)-Lack of any customer supportOverallThis product is not worth the $100 price tag. I would expect to pay about $30 for something of this caliber, but I would still be upset since the camera is so unreliable. I would not recommend this camera to anyone, there are plenty of other options in the same price range. I ordered a Foscam FI8910w for less than I paid for the Belkin NetCam. The Foscam comes with a boatload of features that the Belkin does not offer. The Foscam is supposed to show up tomorrow, so I'll find out if it's any better. Watch for my review there as well. The bottom line on the Belkin NetCam is that you should consider other options. Regardless of what you are trying to accomplish, this camera will fall short of your expectations.

Reviews.Title: Stopped syncing with my iPhone
Reviews.Author: Bene "Seattle Cat Lover"
Reviews.Content: This camera took several times to hook up to my iPhone which is why I purchased it in the first place. Then it completely quit working and won't hook up to anything. Some people have said they had to use an internet cable but I bought it to put in my window and there is no way to get an internet cable to my kitchen window. So now I am stuck with a useless piece of crap camera and I cannot return it. Don't buy!Frustrating!

Reviews.Title: Glitches out all the time.  No Tech Support
Reviews.Author: jenny
Reviews.Content: If you plan on actually using this for surveillance, this is not a good choice. It's a faulty product in general, constantly freezing up and/or crashing.  There's no way to record the data or play it back.  Even if you try to record it with quick time, the view just freezes up, times out and quits.  Often times, when opening the app, no camera is detected and you have to reboot from the location of the camera.  When you try to call tech support, all you get are foreign operators who speak poor english, have a horrible connection and  only want to sell you customer support for $100+.  Otherwise they won't tell you a thing.  Something that would make this product work make sense as the surveillance camera it claims to be would be to offer saved data recordings emailed to you.  That way you could have a video to look back on and the opportunity do delete it if there is no theft detected/no reason to review it.  I would gladly pay for a service like that.

Reviews.Title: Total Nightmare!!!!!!!!!1
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Bills
Reviews.Content: Recieved my  camera via Amazon Prime.  Left it on my front porch out in the open for someone to steal. Thanks Amazon :(  Downloaded the app to my LG smartphone.  Keeps asking me for a username and password.  I use the username and password that I created in my account.....KEEPS SHOWING INVALID!!!!!!!!  When I log in on the Belkin Website via my lap top, it asks me for an e-mail/and password...not a username and password.  To top it all off....the e-mail/password log in is not working either.  Now I can't login the phone or computer.  I can log in via computer is by clicking a link from my e-mail. This is by far THEEEEEEEEEEEEE WORST product I've ever bought from Amazon.  Belkin your company should really be ashamed to put out crap like this.  Classless.  I better get some good results tommorrow (because it's late at night) or this will be going back, and never will I purchase from Belkin again.Respectfully,Mr. Bills

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Auggie  meyer
Reviews.Content: This camera is way better than any other I have tried, no software, no pain, just plug and play. Before people review these, they should find the facts. You CAN view online, or have it as a closed circuit cam. This thing rocks out for the price. I love it. The app is sweet too. If you want a camera that zooms, or has an IP address, spend double or triple the money and get one :)

Reviews.Title: Sound is really bad. Software quality is poor and looks abandoned.
Reviews.Author: Illya Yalovyy
Reviews.Content: All apps are very basic. Very unstable. Picture is 10-60 seconds behind. Considering returning it back. Would not recommend to friends. Expected much more from that brand.

Reviews.Title: Connectivity and app
Reviews.Author: Hillwgh
Reviews.Content: The camera slides in and out between on and off line constantly. Even with resetting the device and app there are still issuesApp isn't very good at all however the online site is ok of your camera is onlineThe motion detection feature is all this is good forI wouldn't recommend this to a friend

Reviews.Title: Confusing specs
Reviews.Author: quitos
Reviews.Content: I thought this cammera had an interface similar to the Samsung ones, with an app and configurable alerts... it just doesn't and it most definitely should! Night vision works but the frame rate is painfully slow. The lack of alerts is so dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: Not great
Reviews.Author: M Lewis
Reviews.Content: Still to this day it has never sent me an email so that feature is useless. Camera works ok but takes a lot of band width. Audio is poor and it has a constant hiss. Night vision is very limited.

Reviews.Title: Simple set up, great video, nice wide angle!
Reviews.Author: KindlePad
Reviews.Content: I really love this little camera. I previously had a similar D-Link camera and I had it on a shelf in the living room so I could check on the house (and the kids) while at work or traveling. That was an ok camera, but the quality was so so and the angle was pretty narrow. Plus you had to set it up via a hardwired connection to your router, etc ugh... painful.However, this Belkin NetCam Wireless IP cam is so much better. First, you set it up all on your tablet or smartphone and creating a free online account. That took about 3 mins. Very simple setup.PROS:Easy set up, can all be done via your smart phone or tablet.Very nice video image (for the price, c'mon.. this isn't a $500 camera...)Very good wide angle, I can see all of my living room & most of my kitchen.Night vision! Works really well. I can see nearly everything in total darkness.Has video recording & email motion detect (but I haven't tried those out yet).Decent audio as well. I can listen in to the kids playing in the living room.Nice iphone app, also works with ipad.CONS:No native / universal ipad app, you have to run the iphone app. Boo. Fix this please.

Reviews.Title: Set up is ridiculously difficult, beware
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Brown
Reviews.Content: I got the Belkin NetCam, recommended by a colleague, on Friday. It's now Tuesday and I'm no closer to getting it to work than I was when I took it out of the box. The "three simple steps" boast in the materials is laughable. I've had problems absolutely every step of the way (a new problem at each new stage) and I am sending it back to Amazon. I don't want this kind of hassle.Where Belkin really dropped the ball is in its support materials. Nothing on its website (or elsewhere) addressed each of the various problems I encountered along the way. The service line of course has the weekend off. And even an effort to actually reach someone at the company directly was frustrating at best; the first tech person I got took all my information, laboriously, then accidentally disconnected the call. I called back, the second guy required me to give all info (when I bought it, where I bought it, serial number, name (can you spell that again) three times, putting me on hold in between each time.Then when we finally got that straightened out, and he says "I'm all about helping you," and I say "is the helping going to begin soon?" he says -- oops --  no advanced technicians are available and we'll call you back. I'm still waiting. And p.s. we never got around to talking about my problem so how would he know it required an advanced tech?Disgusting.I love the idea of the product but dislike the execution. Poor job by Belkin.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product
Reviews.Author: HappyChild
Reviews.Content: Nice product. Expected it to work a little faster and of higher quality. I would recommend this product for the price .

Reviews.Title: If you are looking for peace of mind then NO! but great companion to Swann cams
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: ★★-security  ★★★-Functionality and funI got these mainly as protection for my music studio room to watch for fires and of course intruders. Everyday I Still wondered if someone had been unfastening my cable wires because of the numerous "no connection" messages I had gotten when I tried to log in... so I got a swann for backup and locked the receiver in a closet.  The Netcam is good for a Truck driver who just wants to check in on the house. but I just use it for the time alerts on the emails now so that I can go back to view that day & hour with my real camerasCons:1. It can be very "Sometimey" : one time I did the robot in front of it and it did not alert me of motion!but then sometimes it alertsme if the sun changes direction.2. Snaps pics only once Every minute: Any career criminal who cased the joint knows to "peek in" for the first pic to snap a shot at the door then you have one minute to get situated for the second. snapshots should be random or based on movement! If you do manage to get a snapshot U get blurred motion photos because most people tend to move swiftly if they are trying not to get caught.3. SLOW Connecting: The Exterminator sprayed  and opened all cabinets and closets and I only received 3 blurred photos... one from each of my 3 cams (2 were of the door opening and a shadow) By the time the app loaded for me to be able to watch and/or record he was in and out.Pros:1: If you have time to sit and watch it all day on your desktop or laptop its good... Maybe as a baby monitor or something of that sort its great...but not as primary security.Get a good ol' swann or something for backup if you decide on getting one of these because servers can go down and WiFi can be jammed2. Actually works if you wanna keep an eye on the good guys i.e. grandparents , kids, pets, and  machines, but rushing to sign in and press record after receiving an alert of an intruder is stressful when you keep getting a notice that the app is not connecting for some odd reason (thank God for my old fashion cam) but to be fair Netcam's email alerted me to the hour and day so that i could quickly find the time of intrusion with my swann

Reviews.Title: Great cameras
Reviews.Author: Patt
Reviews.Content: These are great. I have 4 of them. When we traveling can keep an eye on the house. It sends me an email if motion occurs on the house. They are very easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: E mail alerts me when there is motion and if I want to see and hear what's going on I just turn on the Web cam and watch. Gr e at!

Reviews.Title: Worth my money
Reviews.Author: RUTH F GARCIA
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Easy phone set up, email alerts and viewing when not at home. I bought 2 one was going offline but other than that it was definitely worth the money. No wires to take down or put up.

Reviews.Title: I R camera
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: Works great only problem is I have to unplug it from time to time it freezes upand will show current picture but one a few hours earlier.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Lucy De La Torre
Reviews.Content: Do NOT buy this as a baby monitor - the connection is unbelievably unreliable. Picture and sound are ok when it can stay connected, but the camera times out and asks if you're still viewing which is really pointless if you're using overnight. The camera will also get persistent connection issues and can't stay connected to the video for more than 5 mins or so.  The picture itself is grainy when in night vision. I can't make out my baby's expressions (i.e. wincing before she starts to cry) but general body language is clear. Sound has a delay, but I'm guessing that's due to internet connection as well.

Reviews.Title: I bought three of these
Reviews.Author: Judy L Fontana
Reviews.Content: I three of these cameras set up in my home now.  I know who is on my porch, I have one facing back slider, and third facing entrance to my master bedroom.  These are the three most likely places to capture an intruder.  I was out of state and was able to ask a friend to pick up a package that was delivered and left on my porch!  I even took a still picture of the delivery person to see if it would be usable if it had been a burglary...it was.  Only downfall with porch camera is if you have a plant or other item that moves in the wind etc. it will activate the camera.

Reviews.Title: You don't always get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: QA-spector "QA-spector"
Reviews.Content: My purpose was to use this devices for security monitoring in my home.I'll start with the positives:-it's a well packaged self-standing, articulated webcam which I can place as far as my internet will allow me to-the night vision works but there's a 4-second delay before activating (a lot can happen in 4 seconds in the dark)-sharing with friends; great idea if the video feed is reliable; like any website that take too long to load or doesn't have what I expect to see - I will not go back.  If I'm sharing video with my friends, I'm probably better just using youtube and my smartphone.What I don't like:-not really a wireless IP camera - You cannot directly connect to this webcam from computer.  Sure - it's got the ability to connect to your network wirelessly/by cable, but it's really a web service.  What you're really doing is going to an external website to view video from a webcam sitting in your home/business.  There is a point where you can connect to your device from your smartphone directly but that's on the initial setup.-smartphone app is mostly useless.  Belkin includes an smartphone app so you can view video from this device; however, I can only connect when I'm on my network.  The video times out within 30min.  So I'm able to watch my home when I'm at home...hmmm.-poor performance  -  If you're looking for 24-7 surveillance, it fails.  It is possible to use screen capture/security webcam software on your computer to "DVR" the displayed video from SeeDonk for later review.  The website times out multiple times a day where you must actively restart and re-login to your account to resume monitoring.-video feed freezes but still broadcasts - There are moments even where  the video capture is not working.  At least viewing through the Belkin app on my smartphone, I've witnessed seeing a frozen image of the video feed while I'm doing something in front of the camera.-IR lights appear red/purple - might not truly be IR: as a surveillance device, I really don't need people to know that it's there.  I shouldn't be able to see IR - so why do these lights appear red?  Is the "night vision" feed gray because the camera is using an extremely low powered flashlight?

Reviews.Title: Problem staying online
Reviews.Author: DONALD J SMITH
Reviews.Content: Works fine for a while then goes out. I've had to restart the whole procedure every few days. I'm hoping updates fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Belkin Netcam
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this. Works great and easy set up. Nice feature is audio but wish it was 2 way instead of just receive. For the price a great buy.

Reviews.Title: this camera exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: dogbreath
Reviews.Content: The camera was very easy to setup.  Had it up and working in less than 20 minutes.  Very clear images including the infrared views.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable and problematic
Reviews.Author: W. Sterling
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Belkin NetCams for my house.  While they worked initially, and for a short period of time, they rapidly began going offline at random times.  Sometimes they would come back, often times I had to reset them.  Finally, both cameras simply stopped connecting altogether.
