While I was able to get one working by connecting it via Ethernet, neither would connect to any wireless router - a problem which negates the "wireless" part of their name.The cameras look and feel cheap and their performance underscores this impression.  Don't spend your money on these.

Reviews.Title: One of the best, easy installation security cams I've ever used.
Reviews.Author: Terrence B. Schroedle
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Works exactly as promised. Great for pool area, baby's room, security camera, at front door etc.  Or watch your home, your babysitter anytime you'd like.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Zamora
Reviews.Content: Bought a second camera so we're able to check in on our baby while at work.  Great that it comes with sound since she's starting to talk it up.  Night vision is good, but she get distracted by the infared light, so we try to only use it when she's already asleep to look in on her.

Reviews.Title: Hardware Great, Minor Software Issues
Reviews.Author: MonkeyPull
Reviews.Content: I have three at home.  Setup was a breeze.The picture quality and video are very good, even over 3G.  Video is super smooth when connected to WiFi.  The email alerts have been timely and the ability to remotely set the sensitivity for different rooms is great.I can only check one camera at a time however.  If I want to switch cameras, I have to reboot the app.  When I switch cameras within the app, it either shows the first camera I checked or rapidly flashes between multiple cameras.If the software issue is fixed, I will raise the rating to five stars.

Reviews.Title: love the camera
Reviews.Author: revamaia
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  It did everything you said it will do and have recommended to other already.  In fact I have bought 2 more so I can watch my house from work.

Reviews.Title: Not very dependable...
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Judd
Reviews.Content: The camera's have proven to be a disappointment…they will not stay logged on to the router/internet.  And we only learn this when trying to view remotely…which was the purpose of installing them in the first place...

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Gary E. Summers
Reviews.Content: For me, the camera was easy to get set up and running in minutes, it is a good product, for the money I don't think you can beat it. in fact I like it so well I ordered two more.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality picture
Reviews.Author: Ramon Garcia
Reviews.Content: For some reason the picture are blury. Too much problem at time of log in, some time you can't get acces or be Abel to see a y tinglado.

Reviews.Title: Belkin
Reviews.Author: Giorgi Paikidze
Reviews.Content: Camera is as described. nice quality. but you cant access two users at the same time. night vision can be better. but still nice product.

Reviews.Title: NetCam
Reviews.Author: PETER  R. HACKER
Reviews.Content: Very happy with ease of setup and quality of picture. Only drawback is the local WiFi use and internet. If your local network goes down you are dead in the water.

Reviews.Title: App finally updated today!
Reviews.Author: joe picchietti
Reviews.Content: The app has always been a low point of the product but as of today it updated and works a LOT better. The screen finally takes up the whole display of the iPhone 5+Switching cameras and turning on the audio is much faster and finally meets my expectations. The record still works in app, now there is a premium account option to record to the cloud, I'm not sure on pricing though.Overall I may get a third netcam because of how much they have improved!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Barbarajean
Reviews.Content: The only thing that this doesn't do is notify you when someone is in range of the camera.  I have this at both of my homes and I really rely on them for security reasons.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Gina L. Newman
Reviews.Content: Great product. Very easy set up and it makes me feel more at ease to have this in addition to an alarm .

Reviews.Title: feeling secure
Reviews.Author: Vicki L Fuhrmann
Reviews.Content: I have bought more than one of these cameras and really like their easy setup and installation. I can access the cameras easily from my smart phone and check on my dogs anytime I want. I would love it even more if I could talk to them when they are up to no good lol..maybe a future application

Reviews.Title: Poor sound quality
Reviews.Author: Maureen H.
Reviews.Content: Set up easy. As others describes.Video quality good.Sound is awful and does not work - due to the amount of feedback.

Reviews.Title: sorry I wasted my money
Reviews.Author: danceislife
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this product. Video quality not good and has limitations. I am sorry I wasted my money as I will need replace this with something else.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working. Had to reset
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera now for a month or two. At first it was easy and simple to use. But two times now the camera has stopped working. I have had to turn the camera off and turn the camera back on and my phone App only recognizes the camera as adding a "new camera". So I have to give it a name and enter in my username and password. Hopefully it's just some glitch that it'll work itself out and be fine. But right now I am regretting buying it. If it turns out it's just something simple or something dumb that I did I will come back and modify this review. But, for right now, I'm giving it one star. Also the camera quality, even on the highest quality settings, is not so great. When I see images of myself I can barely recognize that it's me. If ever I had an intruder I doubt that I would have an image of the intruder that was clear enough for me to ever identify that person. But at least with the email alert system, I would know I was having an intruder. I did/do enjoy the peace of mind that the camera gives me about keeping my home secure.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Denise Smalley
Reviews.Content: This was the second camera we added to our network and we could not be happier. The best Christmas present my son ever asked for

Reviews.Title: very poor
Reviews.Author: Edward Kaplan
Reviews.Content: This is the most user unfriendly item that I've ever purchased...it worked for a short time and after spending countless hours myself and with the aid of more technology savvy people, the webcam did not perform...I think this webcam should be taken off the market! I plan to return it...

Reviews.Title: good product but hit and miss.
Reviews.Author: Harriet Teich
Reviews.Content: Works 80% of the time. Somes video freezes. Email alert s miss movement. Does not like cold. Needs update. Please.

Reviews.Title: Confirmed my worst fears
Reviews.Author: KCL
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera because I had a paranoia that someone had been in our home.  It arrived and I was able to set it up and start playing with the settings in minutes.  Two days later I got an email notification when I was at work with two pictures of a person I didn't know in my house.  I quickly logged into the camera and took 5 minutes of recorded footage, unfortunately the perp had already left by the time I saw the email.  But I was able to forward the images to the police directly.  The cop was so impressed, he asked me where I got the camera.My only complaint is that the resolution isn't great so the still images the camera took are pretty blurry.  But for the money it is totally worth it, my paranoia is a reality and I'm tempted to get two more to ensure I have a full view of my home to catch this guy.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than a year
Reviews.Author: Michael G Jennings
Reviews.Content: This camera was pretty easy to set up t o view on my iPhone, but after 7 months it stopped working.  A friend of mine has the the same thing happen to her, but hers only lasted 3 months. She actually got the manufacturer send a replacement and then that one died within 2 months.  I haven't tried to get a replacement. It is probably just a bad product.  I advise against purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Bruce K. Andrich "bandrich"
Reviews.Content: This item is Junk save your money and time. Did not work from the moment I received it. Could not get app to start up at all.

Reviews.Title: The camera is a bit too sensitive and slow to catch motion
Reviews.Author: Francine S. Fitting
Reviews.Content: I've had many email photos of the sun coming into the house.  Many times when someone is in the home it will only detect motion as they are walking away, so all I get is part of their back.  It's a nice gadget to use to look at your home while you are away but isn't particularly effective.

Reviews.Title: Belkin NetCam
Reviews.Author: Jenny Mazgaj
Reviews.Content: I ordered two additional cameras to add to my system.  When the products arrived they  seemed to be used or ones that were previously returned.  After DAYS of trying to get these two new cameras to work, even going on Belkin to read every tip available, I finally gave up & will be returning them.  I really like my first camera & am disappointed with these.

Reviews.Title: A 5 star review
Reviews.Author: Tasha L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I've had to purchased the camera back in October of 2013 after a home invasion occurred when I was out if the country. I only purchased 1 camera for my home and one camera for my office. I recently went out of town and I received the email that someone was breaking in my house at 3 a.m.. The camera sent me the email at the same time that the home security system was contacting me. I used the pictures from the email and screenshoted them to the detectives and they apprehended the assailants in less than 30 minutes. I have been a victim of two break- ins and my neighbors have been a victims of more. Had I not had this camera in my house, they would not have been in custody. It is awesome. Once you learn how to navigate and setup the router your fine. The only drawback is it is corded to an outlet and you do have to have wifi system. But hands down it is awesome; it outperformed the home alarm system by far. After this I went and purchased more.  Another draw back is it is only an indoor camera. I am looking for them to make the same version in an outdoor all weather model.

Reviews.Title: Dont bother
Reviews.Author: A.-NJ
Reviews.Content: I switched when these continually don't work in terms of Wifi connections.  They're all the same - so easy to install but therefore not powerful in terms of connecting.  I switched to Foscam and am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Camera is good; app is not
Reviews.Author: Cara C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that I could monitor my dog's activity while I was at work. The camera itself is great. I like that I can set up the alerts to go to my email. However, I've had lots of problems with the app connecting to the camera. Sometimes the camera needs to be turned off and on to reset it and you can't do it from the office!

Reviews.Title: Great monitor for pets
Reviews.Author: Robert J.
Reviews.Content: Christmas Gift for my Wife to check in on her dog when she is away. It works perfectly from her Samsung Galaxy III.

Reviews.Title: The Worst Support Company
Reviews.Author: Martha Geiger
Reviews.Content: I have the camera. The kid who installed it for me put the power cord in a poor place and in no time the power cord wire went kaput. I have been trying for DAYS to buy a replacement power cord. That's it. Just a cord. There is nothing on the Belkin website about replacement cords. I emailed and was only given the Customer Support phone number. I then spent hours being shuffled from one person to another, just trying to buy a damn cord. You would think the company would be receptive to someone calling who might want to give  them money. Nope. At one point I was given the number of an outside vendor. Naturally, it didn't carry the cord. Radio Shack was the most helpful, but since I don't know what connector the power cord takes (and I would have to climb a ladder and remove the camera to bring it in), I was not able/willing to guess what might work. In the end, I spliced the damn cord myself---and I am a 66-year old woman, so you know how easy that was. My point is this: buy the camera at your peril, because if you need replacement parts, Belkin is not going to help you at all.

Reviews.Title: Check the support sites first
Reviews.Author: Joe Obrin
Reviews.Content: Before you consider this camera, you should be aware that it basically does not work if the Belkin webcam website is down.  It is down right now.  According to the forums, this is an undoing problem that goes back at least five months.  Whenever it happens, Belkin support tells people to reset their camera.  But, right now (for example) you can't even log into the site.  That is[...]Wont' even accept a user name and password.  So, how is that the camera's fault?See also:[...]Read through it carefully.  Although the problem is obviously with the Belkin website, people are told over and over again to reset the camera to factory settings.I wish I did my research before making this purchase.  I certainly would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: shlomo katz
Reviews.Content: Picture isn't the best for fine details but this is perfect for our simple use. Comes with mounting screws as well

Reviews.Title: Easy setup
Reviews.Author: jmkamer
Reviews.Content: So we bought this in order to ensure our puppy and home are safe, and this does just the job!It has a lot of features on the website such as motion tracking, which then sends emails with pictures!The great thing about this is it has sensitivity settings so for our dog, it doesn't pick up unless he dives at his cage or something.I also was worried that I wouldn't be able to set this thing up since we are on wireless that we actually have to log on to a webpage rather than use an SSID password.(connect as it tells you, then with your computer, go to your browser and log in).The picture is great, but the only thing I don't like is that it won't let you view your camera via mobile if the resolution is high and you're not on wireless. I understand, but still annoying. The good thing is that you can change the settings from your phone.Very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: I can see you
Reviews.Author: Ruth Schultz
Reviews.Content: It does pretty well, some of the pictures could be clearer, But it works really well.  It's just the right size.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: A. Perret "the dude"
Reviews.Content: I expected a little more clarity in the video - when it takes a picture and emails you an alert it's really hard to make out a person. I suppose you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: dumb camera
Reviews.Author: Lissa Vargas
Reviews.Content: says smartphone yet only works with android phone. everyone who enters my house with an android can see on camera. really dumb

Reviews.Title: Decent little cam, but nothing extraordinary.
Reviews.Author: Emily Witt
Reviews.Content: We bought this to monitor classrooms at our school and listen in on/watch instructors as we build new curriculum around the standard content that they teach. It has served this purpose sufficiently, but not outstandingly.PROSIt's nice to be able to see what's going on when you're far away (even across the country). It was easy to set up and is easy to move from room to room without additional set up steps. The app was also easy to install on my iPhone and my co-workers's Android. Log-in is smooth every time and the video loads within a few seconds. Taking pictures and video captures works well on my iPhone.CONSThe sound it not great, and the video lags slightly when the quality is high enough to what most would consider a "good" picture. My main complaint is that when you watch the feed on the website (versus on a smartphone) here is no way to turn the audio on. If you have an apple or android device this isn't a problem, but it's a little inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: thank you
Reviews.Author: supakit Chanthavanich
Reviews.Content: thank you so much that I can use it in my country very easy.  it is good to have it. very easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Paul E. Partyke
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera at Brookstone and came home and set up the online account. We then downloaded the app onto my iPod and attempted to turn it on. Each time we logged in we were told the name and password were incorrect. I tried to get ahold of the support team, which you can ONLY access via a chat service. I informed the helper of my problem and she told me to reregister again which we did. We then tried to access the camera through the web and were told our account doesn't exist even the Belkin website showed us as an active account. After two hours of trying I gave up and am taking this piece of garbage back to Brookstone. Don't even think you will get service if you spend your money on the piece of useless trash.

Reviews.Title: Belkin camera is personal "I spy."
Reviews.Author: John H Brown
Reviews.Content: Easy setup, works well. Detects slightest motion, even in dim light. Nice addition to anyone's security system.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: JohnK "John520"
Reviews.Content: Item as described!  Fast delivery.  Works perfectly and is a cheaper alternative to the high def. model.  For home security use, I don't think the extra money for a high def. is necessary.

Reviews.Title: LAST ONLY A MONTH
Reviews.Author: s
Reviews.Content: Started out ok..not great but it worked ok....about a month later it was harder and harder to connect till finally died...colors got shot too..anything dark showed up as purple....(in color mode.non ir)

Reviews.Title: Constantly having to reboot!
Reviews.Author: Judith B. Hempstead
Reviews.Content: I reLly like it when it works!  I'm constantly having to unplug the device, reboot and start over. As of the this week I cannot get it to woke at all! Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Buying this was a mistake
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Eduardo"
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the video image is sharp, and the automatic switching to IR works well. However, what I receive on my smartphone is about 1.5 minutes behind realtime...that's MINUTES behind. The absolute killer for me is that it won't re-boot after a power failure. I had hoped to use this cam for watching the house while I'm on vacation, but with the typical 2 or 3 power hits around my neighborhood. I couldn't ask my neighbor to come and re-boot the thing because the software is so clunky and slow. In our beach house we have a Foscam remote camera that we like much better.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced toy
Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: Not much more than an overpriced toy. I purchased three of them hoping to use them as security tools. They only work 50% of the time. They go offline frequently and the only way to bring them back online is to physically unplug them and reboot them. Not very helpful if you are on vacation and they go offline. No way to bring them back up until you get home.The photo they use of the dog sniffing the camera? Well that's about all they are good for. Entertainment value only. An overpriced toy.

Reviews.Title: Super simple to install.
Reviews.Author: R. Lutz "catmanfishing"
Reviews.Content: Have been using it for about 2 weeks and I am very pleased with the technology you get for so little money.  The e-mail alerts are a little slow but it does send you two photos, after detecting motion.  I wish the image was a little clearer, so I plan on getting another with HD images.

Reviews.Author: Online addict shopper
Reviews.Content: Not that clear, if a person move to fast the captured picture is blurry! Not happy with this product. Look around first before buying this device.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with Blackberry or Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: GlassLady
Reviews.Content: The ad says it works on Smart phones, it will not work with my Blackberry. The only tablet I own is a Kindle Fire and I could not connect to Belkin or get answers on thier site, so back it went.

Reviews.Title: poor range?
Reviews.Author: C4D
Reviews.Content: A customer could not get this installed. He stated that he called Belkin support and also returned to the Vzn store where he purchased this camera and no one could get it to work. II spend about 45 minutes and finally got it to work in close range (to the router).Now, the idea of using a smartphone to setup the camera is good, but the app is not friendly at all, once it has trouble connecting to camera, you would be closing and reopen the app and/or resetting the camera and start over. So, to setup, put it somewhere close to the router first before putting it at the desired location, this way, you know the issue is with the range or the camera.Now, the router is old, but I was thinking that if smartphone could connect to the router at the location, then it should be ok. Wrong! I am either going to try a repeater or replace the old router for this case.

Reviews.Title: Died in 3 weeks.  No support available
Reviews.Author: Sharon Blifford
Reviews.Content: bought the Belkin netcam camera, set it up, and was delighted.  I got lots of still photos for 3 weeks.  Moved it to another spot in the same room and it quit.  Online support is no help.  Can't even log into the website.  Suddenly they don't recognize my email address or password.  Disgusted.No human contact available.  I bought this at Verizon but they won't support it.

Reviews.Title: Night view Stinks
Reviews.Author: S. L. MELO "MeloMama"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at an electronics store for $99.00.  I was pretty impressed with the simple set up and clean design.  Unfortunately the night vision doesn't sell me on keeping this product. We will be looking for another camera to set up on our front porch instead.+Beautiful slick design+Nice swivel base+Easy set up-Bad, bad, night vision

Reviews.Title: It's a winner -- when it works
Reviews.Author: Mark L. Olson
Reviews.Content: I bought a NetCam about a year ago and it worked like a charm.  There are a few things I don't like, but it really is great value for the money.Great value for the money when it works, that is. I bought a second unit in June and have never been able to get it to work reliably. It worked when I first set it up, but failed three days later while I was on vacation and I have never been able to get it working reliably again.  Now, during setup, I connect to it and then the NetCam app returns a message "Cannot open URL" and I get no further. (Also, it runs hot compared with the first unit, so I suspect a problem.)Belkin is no help.  They do not supply support (which I can't blame them, for a $90 gadget) but neither could I find support pages dealing with this (and for that I *do* blame them!).So do I figure I've got a 50:50 chance of them working and just treat them as costing $180?

Reviews.Title: can't connect to Android
Reviews.Author: holdurbreath
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time buying this crap..it will not works...trust me..don't waste your time and money..the app is garbage..won't let you connect to netcam ..junk

Reviews.Title: Really bad and unreliable product.  Avoid!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Munoz
Reviews.Content: I bought two Belkin Netcams last month and this product is definitely not worth spending a dollar in it.  The cameras are easy to install but that is about it.  They are really unstable, the picture quality deteriorates for no reason (and does not come back unless you are there to reset the camera), the image gets turned left to right (again, impossible to fix in remote), and at that stage the night vision does not work anymore... all this if you are lucky.  If not, one camera will disconnect for no reason (and cannot be blamed to the wifi connection, camera and router  are in the same room with perfect wifi signal) and will not reconnect...  or the cloud-services will just not work.  The average time you can rely that the cameras will be working ok after configuration is 1 to 2 days, so do not go for a couple of weeks on vacation thinking you will be able to see yoir house from the distance.  not after two days, at least. A shame for Belkin, Really crappy product that they should not commercialize. Avoid!!!,

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Device!!!
Reviews.Author: Sheep
Reviews.Content: The Netcam will only work with my smartphone occasionally, but most of the time I can view a poor video with horrible resolution. I can almost never view the Netcam from the website on a browser, I have tried to log on to the Belkin website from numerous desktops & laptops and will never get a video stream. On the rare occasions I do get a video stream I get error within 10 minutes that ends the stream, never to connect again. I can only view from my Android smartphone but not always. If you only plan on using a smartphone to view your video then it might be an ok cam, but if you plan on using any browser to view from Belkin's website, good luck... and the offshore customer support is absolutely worthless! I purchased this camera when I purchased a new smartphone because the sales rep talked me into it, I had not done any research. After my purchase and after several hours on the phone with Belkin's worthless support I did some research and found that most people can not view videos from a browser. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality video for the price.
Reviews.Author: ADK Corner Store
Reviews.Content: The quality of the video is excellent for such an inexpensive camera. The setup was SUPER EASY and the Belkin NetCam app is great.

Reviews.Title: Camera works. iPad/Phone screens need to be refreshed every now and then
Reviews.Author: Smart TV Owner
Reviews.Content: Using it as a baby monitor. Audio/Video is great. Keep refreshing video every few minutes on iPad and Android Phone is annoying.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: Rafael Giusti
Reviews.Content: The fact that you don't need a computer to configure it really works. The night vision works really well too.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Judy David
Reviews.Content: the picture is clear night and day. the sound quality very good. easy to hook uk. This camera would be great with a sd card for motion recording.

Reviews.Title: Not exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: johnnyoh
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a way of keeping an eye on our vacation home. It's 1,200 miles away from our residence. I intended to use it as a break-in alert and in conjunction with a wifi thermostat to monitor indoor humidity by placing a hygrometer in view of the camera.  I was able to pull up the camera using the app and web site from the airport which is 72 miles from the camera and it worked fine. When I returned home the camera was no longer assessable. I'm not very tech savy so the bandwith error message I got was not helpful in restablishing a connection. Good thing I selected the "any movement" setting for email alerts. The 5+ email alerts I get each day have pictures attached so I'm able to use the camera as I intended by default.The pros are: easy setup, good night vision, snap shot and video feature and email alerts. The cons are: no support from Belkin, connectivity seems to be limited by distance.

Reviews.Title: Not very reliable
Reviews.Author: JN
Reviews.Content: Out of the box I found it difficult to connect to my Wireless and called Belkin to get help. Tech Support was very good. Up and running it has been unreliable with camera going offline. The night vision also shut down on one occasion so view was dark. I am thinking about returning this unit.It is now a few months later and I am glad I did not return it. I was able to monitor my home while away and it also emailed me photos if the camera went off and was able to see no need to be concerned. Low cost home monitor works for my needs but not for someone who needs to be able to remotely scan a whole room.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for a camera not requiring a computer
Reviews.Author: Gregg Lengling
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup, make sure you read the instructions first, or you'll get lost....Android app works okay, at times it gives an error low bandwidth but retry usually resolvesExcellent picture and qualityLike the fact it doesn't have to route thru a computer, but just thru a wifi router as we use this to keeps tabs on my invalid father who lives alone.I'd recommend this to my friends.What I'd like to see is 2 way audio, it's nice I can see and hear what's going on but it would be nice to send audio back in case my dad can't get to the phone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After a semi-nervous breakdown trying to set up a camera through a Windows netbook (we use Linux mainly), I found this one that needed no PC. And it was very easy to set up. Worked great. Apps worked on Android and iPad from other networks. Then it wouldn't access the image after a few hours. Ugh. Thought I'd be sending it back. Looked at the simple instructions again and noted it said not to change channels on router. Hmmm. Logged onto router settings (I have a dlink) and set channel to static.  So far, this has kept the camera online.The image is good enough for our purposes. I'd think an HD would look great, but may be harder to stream through my 3g phone.Will update in a few weeks after we have really used it.Also will add:  if you think the email motion alerts are not working, check your spam folder in email.  That's where mine were.  Sends you a pic.Assuming this keeps working as it is, I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install and View from Smartphone
Reviews.Author: STEVEN M BOWER
Reviews.Content: I am using it to check on my vacation cabin property after planting some new grass.  Working great.  May buy a second one.

Reviews.Title: Belkin NetCam
Reviews.Author: Michael "tizigman"
Reviews.Content: Took about 5 minutes from the time I took it out of the box and had it up and running.  Picture quality is good and sound quality ok.  Unlike some of the other reviewers I had no problems with the iPhone app.  The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because you cannot set timer events for the motion sensor.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and use
Reviews.Author: Ant Kim
Reviews.Content: I looked up reviews and was very happy to see that the reviews were accurate.  It was simple to set up and works very well.  I occassionally have to re-start the app on my phone, but overall, I think it works really well.

Reviews.Title: VERY easy set up
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Braun
Reviews.Content: I read about all the problems people had setting up cameras.  This one was so simple I ordered a 2nd one the next day.  No IP address stuff or settings.  Just flip a switch open the iphone app and connect.  Then it logs in and sets up the camera on your WIFI network.  You don't need to know anything about computers.  Love the ability to check on the home from my phone.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: erin
Reviews.Content: May end up buying one for other area of house. Super easy set up and my only request would be zoom ability.

Reviews.Title: Thin Amazing Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Candra C. Georgi "mommy of many"
Reviews.Content: We own several video monitors for our house to keep a "third eye" on our 3 little boys under 6 and our baby girl in our large house. I really liked this one because of how clear it's picture was and how small and sleek of a design it has. Fits really nicely in the corner of her wall without being overly noticeable.Pros:-Thin, Sleek, "hid-able" color and design-Clear color picture-Clear black and white like night vision picture in a very dark room for baby-App downloaded easily-Followed colorful simple directions and immediately camera worked-App is easy to access and use to see picture where baby is-Lots of rotating positions for mounting

Reviews.Title: Returning to Amazon. App Won't Let Me Sign ON
Reviews.Author: D.. Forrest
Reviews.Content: At this point, I'd give this product ZERO stars because I can't startup the app. I gave two because of customer support, once I FOUND them.Following all instructions, I hooked up the cam and downloaded the Netcam app to my Samsung Galaxy. But instead of getting a screen that allowed me to setup an account, I got a login screen, asking for a username and password. The very BRIEF fan folded directions contained no troubleshooting information, nor contact information. Worse, I couldn't find any phone numbers for customer support on the Belkin website.I did get the phone number (with extension for direct contact with a live person) via an online search engine. Having done so, and after providing much detailed information, the rep attempted to assist me through every step of the setup process, by having me reset the camera, re-install the app., etc.  A half hour later and my problem wasn't solved. The rep told me he'd have someone from a higher level of customer support call me. Indeed they did, from corporate offices in L.A.The second rep stepped me through pretty much the same process, but my problem wasn't solved. He suggested I could use another android based tablet or device to set up the account, but I didn't have one.Finally he said it might be a problem with my phone (a possibility) and suggested I return the camera to Amazon for a replacement, only, the item is currently selling for more than my original purchase price. We'll see how that goes, and I'll update this review accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Mobile but limited
Reviews.Author: Valnastar "Man With No Name"
Reviews.Content: Set-up pretty straightforwardWide-Angle Video is a positive so you see a bigger areaNight-vision is good qualityCan send out a message alert via email when motion is detectedAverage product - no frills

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, reliable
Reviews.Author: CoryPi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to keep an eye on my dogs...one has cancer and the other likes to get into things when I'm not home.  I've been impressed with how reliable this camera has been.  I've been able to check in on the house from work or even more importantly, when I have to go out of town for work.  It's also given me a little insight on why my destructive dog does what he does...I can watch him on my phone when I leave the house and see what he does!I have DSL, and it kept going out when i first set the camera up, but I made some adjustments to the camera settings and now they are working well together.  The picture isn't crystal clear, but it's good enough for what i'm using it for.  The night vision works great too!

Reviews.Title: NetCam Awesome
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Up and running i minutes.  Great pic quality. Excellent night vision capability, too.  I am going to get some more.

Reviews.Title: Customer service is terrible.  Probably the worst I have ever dealt with in my life.  I will do my best to not purchase another
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: When installing the camera the metal/plastic mount portion snapped off.  I have contacted customer support multiple times over a period of months and finally recieved a reply to contact an 800 number to attempt to resolve the issue.  This is something so simple that could have been mailed to me instead of wasting tons of time and I still do not have an functioning unit.  I will do my best to not have to deal with Belkin for any customer service issues ever again.  I have not been quite as displeased with a company in some time.  The camera works fine however it is sitting on the bench in my garage.  Not quite the use I had anticipated. Amazon was great as usual, just displeased with Belkin.Final update. 48 minute phone call to Belkin and 5 emails later and they can't/won't do anything.  Buy anything but Belkin.  I am guessing it will save you from any blood pressure issues.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, poor connection
Reviews.Author: jim mcminn
Reviews.Content: Very good quality - in day light and night time with IR.  However, if you log on from mobile device it connects easily but seems to always lose the connection within 30 seconds or so.  If you log in from a PC, it retains the connection better but seems to only allow me to connect about 50% of the time from a PC.I like the product but the connection issues need to be resolved.

Reviews.Title: Reviewing for use solely as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Hedonia
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this based solely on using it as a baby monitor (which it is marketed as being appropriate for). While the image quality was acceptable, and the night vision far surpassed my expectations, the very poor audio coupled with inappropriate software restrictions makes this completely unusable as a baby monitor.The problem is that you need to login in to the app constantly, and  wait for the image to load. Most phones won't keep the screen on all night, and every time my phone screen shut off it would log me out and disconnect. If I heard a squawk from down the hall and wanted to check to see if the baby was awake or just making noise, I needed to launch the app, type in a password, click on the name of the camera (even though I only had one), and wait for it to load.You might be willing to change your settings to leave screen on constantly, and leave phone plugged in, but I don't need a huge glowing light next to my bed, nor do I wish to completely destroy my phone -- I think it would melt a hole in my nightstand if I did that all night.I had assumed I could just click the app button and have instant video, since they're both on the same WiFi network, but instead the camera transmits to Belkin's website, then the app streams from the website. Silly, and a little creepy.

Reviews.Title: Tedious at first
Reviews.Author: SAMUS "GADGET"
Reviews.Content: I have discovered that this only works through Belkin's severs. I don't like this idea at all for the sake of privacy. If I can't discover a work around, I will return this for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Belkin NetCam Wireless IP Camera for Tablet and Smartphone with Night Vision and Digital Audio
Reviews.Author: In the AmaZone...
Reviews.Content: This camera works decently, but may not be the best for everyone depending on your intended use.  I am using it to check up on my dogs at home while I am at work, and it does that quite well.  I would not buy this for home security purposes however, there are other better camera systems that are better set up to record activity and email valid alerts.  The audio quality on this camera is poor to fair at best and the still-shot picture quality is about the same.  I have a similar camera (identical looking) from D-Link and the set-up and user interface are more user friendly, and that one I alternate uses to monitor activity at my front door or monitor the dogs' activities while at home alone (and it is still not what I would consider to be a security camera either). I have had problems with this Belkin camera just disconnecting from my network and having to be re-setup again when I get home, so I wouldn't consider the dependability to be to be as high as the other one either.  I found that the night vision works pretty good on this. In the end, I found that the best use for me for this camera is just as a second camera that I can check to see what my dogs are up to.  I could not set it up for any other use that was practical and had the motion sensor set up with email alerts that didn't flood me with emails throughout the day. I think if maybe Belkin would invest a little bit more in their application and interface, this could be a much better product.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera
Reviews.Author: J. Levenson
Reviews.Content: Very good static pictures with wide angle.  Slow capture rate of stills causes blurring. Sound is awful - full of static (many others complain of this also)

Reviews.Title: After days of messing around with it......
Reviews.Author: g.Garcia
Reviews.Content: So after days of messing around with my NetCam, it finally works! I had to connect BOTH cams in order to work....I kept getting time outs and a yellow triangle with an (!) which after doing some research I guess meant that my wifi connection was not reaching that one cam. The design is nice and clean but I do wish it came in different colors being that it's not easy to hide. I would say the best part of this product really is the fact that the setup us sooooooo easy!...I was really surprised, you just unpack, plug in, find wifi connect flip switch and YOU'RE DONE!Would I get another YES, but.....if its on sale. With a price tag that's so high there's much room for improvement on the technical side of things, like the TIME OUTS, THE MIXED VIEWS when using two of more cams and the fact that I have found myself having to unplug and replug one of my units that seems to just drop off the serve every 12-15hrs..urgh!

Reviews.Title: Setup was easy
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Camera works well.  Setup was easy. I would consider a few more for other areas around my home. Because of glare problems, camera does not work well looking from inside to outside through glass.

Reviews.Title: Simple and effective
Reviews.Author: O.E. Frik
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up. I had a hard time finding the free NetCam.app at first searching the App Store, however a quick visit to the Belkin website pointed me in the right direction. Unfortunately the iOS app is only for the iPhone. There is no ipad version and using the 2X setting is sub par on the ipad. Camera resolution is not great either but for its intended purpose, it is adequate. Considering the price of similar net cams, this is a satisfactory product.

Reviews.Title: Good overall, but there are less expensive options
Reviews.Author: Doffod "Bookworm"
Reviews.Content: A quality wireless surveillance camera made by Belkin, adequate for home use. I also happen to have two of the 8910 model Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black) made by Foscam, they almost offer exactly the same functionalities including the apps for iphones and other smart phones, but at a much lower price, you could find it for below $100, sometimes even cheaper when it's on sale. Setting them up does take a little more time than the Belkin model since the instructions are hard to decipher, but their Tech Support helps a lot too.

Reviews.Title: Nice, not stellar
Reviews.Author: Soar
Reviews.Content: The camera is relatively easy to setup.  Just pay attention to the instructions.  Your cell phone is connecting directly to the camera for setup.The App was easy to download and setup via an iPhone 4S.  It would be helpful to have much better descriptions ONLINE for each of the settings that can be adjusted on the camera.  It felt like a bunch of guessing... what is the difference between 1 and 5 for sensitivity settings?The camera image is ok, fine for the price.  I don't use the infrared so can't judge that.  I primarily set the camera up to trigger on movement and send an image to email.One of my annoyances is that I felt like I kept having to log into the phone app.  Look at something, do something else on the phone, click back to camera app... log back in.Overall, its nice.  Well priced.  Just doesn't wow me.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Nanadjj
Reviews.Content: Not real crazy about this, can't zoom in pic not real clear and you can't speak from your phone thru this. It take long time for it to come up on my iPhone and you can't see all cameras on one screen. Would waste my money on any more.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Sean P. Logue "If you can't win, change the r...
Reviews.Content: This was very easy to hook to my wifi network without using an intermediary computer. I connected it, then installed the iPhone App, and I was good to go!At first I was disappointed with the frame rate, but then I realized it is adjustable in the App. So, you can use as much (or as little) bandwidth as you want. It has sound, too, which is somewhat surprising in such an affordable camera.I leave mine hooked up with a low frame rate so I can check on the house every so often when I'm out. It works very well for this!Sean P. Logue, 2013

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work well wirelessly
Reviews.Author: Ernie
Reviews.Content: Here's the REAL scoop on this camera.Pros:  Good video, reasonable price, emails allerts with 2 pictures (if this option is selected in the app), REALLY easy to set up on my iPad 2.Cons:  Doesn't pan/tilt remotely (not a big deal, really), FREQUENTLY drops off the wireless network.  THIS is the biggest downfall of this camera.  I have a secure wireless connection but it still drops out from every several hours to EVERY FEW MINUTES.  I called tech support who suggested a few things, but it' still drops off the wireless network.  I wanted the camera in the window that sees the front door, but I had to remove it from this first-choice position because of dropping off the network.  I placed the camera in the livingroom and "hard wired" it to the network with an ethernet cable.  Works FINE like this.  I'll keep the camera, but I won't buy another one of these.The free app works fine.  Not sure why some reviews trash it.  On ocassion  I have to re-submit the request for live video, but this is not a big deal.  Other than this one little glitch (and many apps have a glitch), it's fine.Botoom line - if you must have a camera on a wireless network, DO NOT buy the Belkin Netcam.  You're going to be in for a LOT of problems and it simply doesn't work well wirelessly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Only negative is that alerts cannot be text to cell phone, other wise works perfect. Infrared is very clear and adjust to light

Reviews.Title: Good cam the only thing...
Reviews.Author: Adam Schraufnagel
Reviews.Content: Great camera, hooks up fast and easy. Picture is very good sound works good. The only thing I wish was different was the record option. You must have tablet or phone always logged in to record and it uses up memory on those. There should be an option for an online server to do this that way your not always using phone or tablet because you can't do anything else when using this app. Which really only makes this camera good for live viewing. But all in all good camera. Maybe one day the option to record online will be there

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: J. Christian "Tech Guy"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to view my dogs when i'm either out of town or at work.  Works great.For $99 I feel that the quality of the products meets the price.  Installation is very easy and takes a matter of minutes.  The app on my Iphone and nexus 7 works great.  Picture quality is acceptable for 480p.  The audio microphone is below average.  It picks up a lot of background noise and makes it very hard to hear noise.  I do wish the camera was higher quality, two way microphone, and a more better app.  That being said for $99 I feel that its a great camera.  I will be purchasing a second camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this thing
Reviews.Author: debra schwebel
Reviews.Content: This camera does just what I needed it to do, the only thing i wish it  had zoom, easy setup, very easy

Reviews.Title: Nice Product!!
Reviews.Author: T. Smith
Reviews.Content: Very easy setup, flawless operation and nice clear picture.Refresh rate is a little slow, but don't need it to be any faster.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, easy, and nice little piece of equipment...
Reviews.Author: Eric A. Hofstetter
Reviews.Content: I really like this Belkin NetCam.  Set up was super easy.  Took me less than five minutes to set it up, download the app for my iPhone, and be looking at whatever the camera was!  I currently use it to watch my front door and at the same time my guard dog who sits right in front of the window as well.  Works great.  I'm also pretty impressed with the nighttime lens as well.  Not as clear as daytime, but everything is pretty recognizable with night vision.  The camera also has a built in microphone, but I choose not to use it, as at night, looking at what is going on around my house... the mic pics up a lot of ambient sounds, and I just dont really want to know if I have any paranormal activity going on in here.  So, overall, very satisfied with this Belkin NetCam Wireless IP Camera.  I would recommend it for sure!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: M. Mullins "Book to Book"
Reviews.Content: Setup was easy (it took less than a minute) and the video quality is very good for a non-hd camera. I'm very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works ok, has some trouble over cellular.
Reviews.Author: J. Riga
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Netcam mostly works as intended. You plug it in, move the rocker switch on the back of it to a place where the app they've asked you to download will "detect" the camera, and proceed with some simple setup steps. I had the camera working with the app after about five minutes of messing with it.  The instructions are clear, but it didn't work on the first try so I had to do the procedure over again.Some frustrations: the camera is made from the absolute lowest quality plastic you can imagine. It looks and feels brittle and cheap. Also to note: the app itself is not optimized for newer iPhone 5's.All of that aside, when on our home WiFi network (with an Airport Extreme router) the camera functions very well. I had repeated issues getting the camera to send video over an LTE cellular network. This was funny to me since the LTE network is much faster than our home cable connection. The cellular connection worked about 50% of the time.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install with Good Picture and Sound
Reviews.Author: scesq "scesq"
Reviews.Content: This is easy to install and works fairly well. The video and sound are fine. It also worked well with my wireless router.Installing this was pretty easy. I usually wind up call technical support when it comes to anything with my computer and I did when it came to making sure my wireless router recognized the camera.  Other than that I had no problem with installation.I am using this on both my home computer and notebook. Installation was easy on both.The picture and sound in fine for something coming over a wireless router. It is not as good as a movie but it is fine.The camera is relatively small and looks nice so it fits well in a room.  This is great for keeping tabs on pets in an enclosed room. It would be great as a baby monitor or to keep tabs on anyone else.I have really not needed to use this at night but I did try the night vision feature and it worked better than I thought. It is actually a fun feature to use.This is a nice camera with a good picture and video. It is easy to install and works well on my computer and my tablet.

Reviews.Title: Bond, James Bond. How cool is this?
Reviews.Author: Sl Judge "gatormomz"
Reviews.Content: Seriously, for less than $100, you can spy on your own house! How cool is that!?  Did you ever tell your kids that mom's know everything? Well this is one way that you will know for sure! Take a video or screen shots of the action! Listen in or choose not too! I set ours up as a doggy cam. For years, we joke about what the dogs do when we leave the house.  Well, now we know!  I seriously felt like Bond, James Bond! Set up was 1-2-3 on my iPhone 4.  Nothing complicated about it!  Pretty close to plug and play!  Download the app and you are ready to watch the action!  5 stars from me. We have had no difficulty or wifi issues.  It's most fun to be away from home and check in on your pets !

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: sandra ramirez
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and instal..the guide is very simple. I bought three of them and I`m very satisfied. I like them

Reviews.Title: Awesome product to purchase
Reviews.Author: Tiger75
Reviews.Content: Belkin NetCam is so useful especially when I am away, I can still remotely log into the camera to view what's heppening at home. It has also night vision infrared that I can view in the dark.I can set it to email myself directly when it senses motion and also remotely take pictures or record any part of the video from anywhere. The picture is clear and has pretty wide viewing angle. It is easy to set-up and very user friendly.So far, this camera has not caused any problems and has been a reliable source to me and my husband. I strongly recommend Belkin NetCam to anyone who is looking for one in the market.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great - streaming is buggy and frustrating
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Parker
Reviews.Content: I don't expect much for a $100 internet camera. In theory, having a camera that streams video and sound over the net so you can keep a wtchful eye on things is great. But in actuality, the overall streaming exprience sucks. I have been running the software on two phones, an older DroidX and a Samsung Galaxy Note 2. Both end results are the same. Sometimes it takes a half dozen times to finally lock in a stream. But inevitably the stream freezes, and so does the phone. I have to wait for a minute for the poor phone to clear up so I can try again. Sometimes I'll get a stream runbning for a while, but that usually messes up if I try to record with the app.The fact that this is not an true IP camera is what makes it bad. It rely's onb Belkin's servers to stream the video, and from my experience it's lousy. I was told by tech support it can be connected in P2P mode, but I see nothing of the sort. You only directly connect wirelessly in setup mode, but must switch off setup mode fot the camera to work.I may still keep it because I can do quck logins to check in on things, but as a longer runiing stream forget about it. You get what you pay for, and this $100 can really be frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Great home Security alternative
Reviews.Author: Oldmanriver
Reviews.Content: While these are probably not equal to a subscription home security service.  They do provide some peace of mind.  They send me an email when movement is detected.  They are relatively easy to set up.  The picture is very good and the night vision works very well.  Its nice to be able to check to see how things are going at my house when Im not there.  The price is probably on the high side of what  you can buy the exact same camera for from other companies but there are some added benefits to buying a belkin.  Belkin cameras have the email alerts as part of the basic package with no monthly fees.  You can also enhance your camera through a subscription.  These have been a great way for me to not worry while I am away from home.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, good value, sparse documentation
Reviews.Author: Jonathan K. Perkins
Reviews.Content: I got this to use as a baby monitor camera, and am comparing it to a Sharx security camera I was using for the same purpose. Both have their pros and cons (the Sharx costs about $250). I like the Belkin camera (setup is a breeze with an iPhone or Android phone), but I do have some concerns. There's very little documentation beyond the setup information. All connections seem to be made through the Belkin web site (it doesn't seem like you can use it on your WiFi network without going out to the Internet for connectivity). There's a setting for "private" versus "online", but there's no documentation on what that setting actually means (they work exactly the same, as far as I can tell). And I have no idea how secure it is.Pros:*VERY easy setup with a smartphone*Good video quality*Check your camera from anywhere (if you have broadband), including a web browser*Infrared night vision is automatic and works wellCons:*Little documentation of some features*Doesn't seem to work with only LTE/cellular bandwidth*Seems dependent on the Belkin website*Video is delayed about five seconds and is less smooth than a camera which operates on your private networkOverall, I like the camera. I'm just a little uncomfortable with what I don't know. I've checked Belkin's web site for additional documentation, but couldn't find answers.

Reviews.Title: A Unique And Useful Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey N. Fritz "Nikon Jeff"
Reviews.Content: The Belkin NetCam is a useful and somewhat unique device.In addition to being a remote camera accessible from virtually anywhere over the Web, the Netcam uses infrared (user selectable) imaging when the light is insufficient for normal camera video. The device can record video, take stills and listen in to what's going on in the room (although the audio is noisy in quiet locations.) The NetCam also has a motion sensor that alerts you by email if there is something amiss. However, a text alert alert might have been more useful.All of this functionality is neatly managed by an iPhone or Android app. Sadly, a native iPad app is conspicuously missing--although the iPhone app will work with an iPad. (Be aware that you will be asked to download and install the free Belkin NetCam app from the iTunes or Android app store. Also be aware that several apps are available on iTunes with similar names as Belkin app. Be sure to select and download the "Belkin NetCam" app.)Set up was not too difficult although the camera did not set up correctly the first time. After a couple of tries it finally worked. The camera worked more reliably over a wired Ethernet connection than it did over a wireless LAN connection.  Perhaps there are too many wireless LANs in my neighborhood. Happily, Belkin made sure that the camera supports both wired and wireless LANs--although the camera must be set up via its wireless LAN capability.I decided that the NetCam would make a good front door monitor, so I mounted  it outdoors to keep watch our front door. However the very cold 15 degree (F) winter temperature proved too difficult for the camera. Although it was not damaged it did stop working. Instead it was moved to our heated basement to keep watch on our basement side door. It performed much better in that location.Typical with so many devices today, the Belkin NetCam documentation is rather meager. It's a foldout paper, legible but lacking in operational detail. On one level this is fine. The instructions concentrate on setup which if, after all, the most complicated part of the operation of the NetCam. On the other hand, information on tasks such as sharing the camera feed with others is decidedly missing. As a result, I never did figure out how to share the camera's feed with my family.Still, the ability to monitor your home from literally anywhere on a variety of mobile devices is very attractive. As long as you don't get it too "1984" with it this is a very useful device.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, don't like you have to use the Belkin App to see it
Reviews.Author: J. Haggard
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera.... But it's not the best camera.I  have had some experience with IP cameras lately and had the chance to try this one out.First, what I like.-It's small-It looks nice, blends into the wall-slim-easy to use, no computer needed.-crystal clear daytime pictures,-night time pictures with nightvision work decent.-able to view it from your phone or tablet.So what don't I like-you CAN NOT view this from a computer, you HAVE to use a portable device.-There is NO FTP option to upload pictures, the only way I've found to get pictures off this thing is through the Belkin app.-When viewing the camera, if you disconnect and reconnect quickly it in my case took over 60 seconds to reconnect, almost as if my first session needed to time out first.-You can't rotate the camera remotely, this is stationary.If you are looking for a basic, slim camera and don't mind having to use the belkin app, this is a great choice. It's easy to setup and use, in fact from unboxing to installation in my garage I had it done in less then 10 minutes.IF you want a camera with night vision, pan/tilt controls, ability to use various apps and configure FTP settings to send pictures to the service of your choice stay away from this camera. For about $25-$50 cheaper I would recommend the Wansview Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring support(Black). I have 3 of these Wansview cameras and they take a bit more time to setup, and aren't that easy to get configured, but they give you a lot more functionality.But if you just need basic, this belkin is a good option.

Reviews.Title: Setup had issues, works OK, kinda?
Reviews.Author: justsomeguy
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get this.  I recently bought the Stem IZON IOS WRM-WA0-00 Remote Room Monitor which is like 30 bucks less than this, smaller, prettier, and looks cooler.  But that Stem camera was garbage.  It didn't work for me, at all.  It had numerous setup issues.This camera is bigger, costs more, but, at least it works.  I am using this with an iPhone 4s.  Here, let's take a look:-1) + Long power cord. I like that this has a long power cord because chances are you're not going to have an outlet near the ceiling where you want to put this anyway.2) + Is wall-mountable.  They even include screws and those plastic things you always need because chances are you're just drilling into sheetrock anyhow.3) - It's big.  No way you're tucking this into the corner of your bookshelf hoping the maid or real estate broker won't see it.  This thing screams "YOU ARE BEING FILMED" but, maybe that's what you need sometimes?4) - Setup wasn't that smooth.  I had issues setting it up.  The first two times I went through the steps, at the very last step, the app would hang forever, and finally give me some non-laymans-term error.  Third time was the charm, and I was FINALLY able to view the camera on my phone.5) - Quality of video, even on the best setting, isn't all that great.  It's choppy, kinda dim.  I mean for looking in on your kids or goldfish, yah, maybe it's OK.  Don't expect seamless video here.6) + Adjustable software settings.  You can adjust the camera from your phone.  You can turn on or off the night vision setting (or leave it on auto - that works really well, actually).  You can change the quality level "1-5" (with no mention of 1 or 5 being better or worse??) [hint: 1 is garbage quality, 5 is "best"].7) ++  Email alerts!  You can set it up so that it will send an email when it detects motion!  AND you can change the sensitivity from your phone!  Emails!  (Remember those!?)  Texts would be hipper, but I'll take the email option.  It sends an email with a couple photos.  I like that a lot.8) --- If you're not on wi-fi on your phone, you're not going to be able to get good quality video/pics.  When I changed my iPhone 4S from wi-fi to regular 3G signal, this thing failed.  I had to set it to the lowest quality setting (think Castle Wolfenstein graphics) to see anything at all.--------End result = it works.  Kinda.  Because you can't get great quality streaming video, it's not much use other than a motion-detector, but for me, I'm quite happy with that.  I do like the emails you get when it detects motion.  I'm going to be renting an apartment soon, and I'd like to see if/when the manager ever enters my unit.  He'll see this camera from a mile away, and maybe that's a good thing?

Reviews.Title: Ok Device with Some Caveats
Reviews.Author: Jerry Palmerino Jr
Reviews.Content: This was easy enough to setup.  In fact, it uses the same method as the Belkin WeMo.  You first download the app to your iPhone/iPad or Android device and then connect to the camera wirelessly (which again, you need an iPhone/iPad or Android device to do it) and you go through the configuration via a downloadable app.The framerate is terrible.  Otherwise, it can be a great spot-check baby monitor or inexpensive security device.  Its not a DVR, so its only practical when you are viewing the video live.  You can record or take snapshots of live video.  I don't suggest leaving the video running on your device, as it will drain the battery.  In fact, on my wife's iPhone, the screen doesn't turn off until you close the app.  I found this to be a curious override of the iPhone's screen timeout.It displays in color during the day (again, on your phone/tablet using the app), and in infrared at night.  The picture is clear, but the one-way sound is nothing but static. That was disappointing.Overall, its...ok.  We originally thought we could use it as a baby monitor, but then its practical limitations came to light.  Its only a spot-check device.It does work over wifi or over the internet using our 4GLTE  phones.  It is probably too slow to view over 3G data.  You an also view it on your pc after you go to Belkin's website (listed in the instructions) and install a plugin (which was not  mentioned in the instructions).I'm happy with it, but only as a spot-check device.(As another review mentioned, it is a re-branding of another brand's camera.  I am not sure if the other brand's version uses the same WeMo-style setup routine.)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: japeurotrash
Reviews.Content: The camera is very easy to set up. The sound part doesn't work well as a lot of hissing, but the night vision works well.It emails you two pictures every time the motion sensor goes off if you have that feature enabled.Would be cool if it could video with the motion sensor, but the pics are pretty good.If you have a VIP folder on ur iPhone, put the belkins camera address in it and set the alarm for that folder and then your phone alarm will ring as it detects motion and then u can log on and videotape the event on top of the pictures it will send you.Works well.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up but hard to use
Reviews.Author: Bman
Reviews.Content: Pro's:It is very easy to install, no computer required.Install App for you phone and power on the camera then on your phone set p to p connection with the camera.Register an account with Belkin. The App will ask if you want to connect to internet.Select SSID and key in the password then the setup procedure is finished.open the App and key in the password then you are ready to view the camera.Video quality and night vision is ok.Con'sVideo delay and audio streams not stable.The video will play about 2 to 3 mins then stopWhen it stops, the App looks like it crashed. (it is very easy to crashed)Some times the App will shout down the phone, I have to power down my phone and reboot my phone.No video storage for motion detection. Conclusions:This camera is not ready for the market yet, although it is very easy to setup. The video play are short(longest time I tested was about 4 min and some time the video delay 1 to 2 mins. I think it is the Belkin server can't handle the bandwidth. The App crashed all the time while I testing the camera and some times it even shout down my phone that will frustrate the customers. The email alarm is working but don't have schedule setting. Currently the camera only works on the phone not on the browsers.

Reviews.Title: Basically Crap... Frame rate slow, video in delayed slow motion
Reviews.Author: THE ULTIMATE PIZZA MANUAL Fan
Reviews.Content: Basically Crap... Frame rate slow, video in delayed slow motion. Instructions vague and out of date:  don't match actual app procedures. Camera has an ethernet port, but there are no instructions on how to use IT instead of wifi. Garbage. Doesn't work with Mac safari: error message suggest you try DOWNgrading your Flash plug-in. (Excuse me??)

Reviews.Title: Disregard any positive reviews- they're outdated -cam no longer works with current APP June 2013-
Reviews.Author: Jack McCormack "Sport"
