Reviews.Title: NetCam quits working suddenly, app unreliable, no remote reset, etc.
Reviews.Author: Christie S. Kitchens "Chapparral"
Reviews.Content: I got this to monitor a pregnant horse and when it is working, it is fine. The problem is that it QUITS working sporadically. The point of having this is so that I do not have to drive to the barn in the middle of the night and this camera is very undependable. Don't buy one and expect it to be a steady, reliable resource. I have a wifi extender that boosts the signal to the barn and other devices work better than ever with the boosted signal but the NetCam still does it's own thing.It's going back on return and I'm getting something else.

Reviews.Title: It Really Works
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my husband's business and he found a place to position it so that you can see almost all of his small store.  He was using the alerts feature to let him know about movement at night, but there were too many alerts coming through due to cars pulling in and out of the parking spaces in front of his store (it is located in a strip mall).The picture quality is good as is the sound.  And it is so convenient to be able to access it from an app on his phone.  Great purchase!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: Only worked half the time. Had to unplug it and restart it daily. Disappointed. When it did work it was great.

Reviews.Title: Worst product ever
Reviews.Author: Aureo Arturo Calles Pa "electronic media"
Reviews.Content: Started out ok..not great but it worked ok....about a month later it was harder and harder to connect till finally died...colors got shot too..anything dark showed up as purple

Reviews.Title: unreliable
Reviews.Author: walter j. wall
Reviews.Content: Picture this--You are traveling and want to check on how things are at home.  You have just recently purchased the Belkin NetCam and have easily set it up.  Every thing has been working fine except that every now and then you get an error message "unable to connect".  Now being at work or otherwise away you are screwed.  You can't just unplug the camera and reboot.  Sooooo, this makes the camera useless.  Once you get that error message everything comes to a halt.  Buying through Amazon was the only good thing about this experience.  Easily returned, no hassle.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable - don't use for baby monitor
Reviews.Author: cva
Reviews.Content: The camera basically works OK, apart from some serious static on the audio.  However, here's the problem... In order to see the camera it has to register with Belkin's servers.  This is to avoid having to open ports and used fixed IP addresses for a domestic device.  That's great except when the Belkin server is down and Belkin are in no hurry to fix it.  Belkin understand hardware - not cloud service provision.I just spent an hour with tech support who first tried to blame "Netcomm" (he didn't know Belkin made netcams), then blame my internet, then advised that someone would do something in 48hrs.  The next guy fortunately did understand, but couldn't talk to the people who own the server, he could just make a note on the support call which "hopefully they pick up in the next 48hrs".Therefore, if you are using this camera to monitor your business, or your baby, or anything else critical to you, you are at the mercy of Belkin's abilty to keep their servers running.  They do not appear to have redundancy, service level commitments or anything else that would support mission critical infrastructure.  Indeed this seems to be a very poorly thought out service.BTW: If you're reading this and work for Belkin, check out support call 130820-002715. If you can hear the audio recording, even better - the first guy is hilariously incompetent.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Dissatified
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera since I travel a lot.  Works when I set it up and am on my home network, worked once for a day when I was gone and that has been it.  I have set this POS up 6 times and it never works when I am gone, the reason I bought it.  Do not waste your money

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, but internet monitoring requires Flash
Reviews.Author: Thomas C. Timberlake
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to configure / set up on wifi network. In order to monitor the camera remotely (away from your home wifi) requires the use of a browser that supports Flash.Motion detection sends out false positive reports at least once per day.Resolution is not that great -- get the HD camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Camera Does NOT work as depicted in teh description.
Reviews.Author: Debbie Langston
Reviews.Content: Camera is not consistent and seems to have mind of its own. Plus -- Belkin support is non-existent, When first connected, the unit seems fine. I was very excited to view and keep track of my pets at home. Over a few hours-days performance started degrading. Image will flip backward....image pixelates...also goes B&W; (infrared) in full daylight. Motion detection works somtimes...and then does not. Microphone  will not turn on (ever)...will not consistently connect to my device. I have had to reinstall camera and app from scratch twice. Very dissappointing. Not sure if it the device...or the App ...or both.When I tried to contact Belkin through their website...no response. But...I did see a slew of other unanswered issues there. Buyer beware. Wish I had checked this out better.

Reviews.Title: Item failed after 3 Months
Reviews.Author: Richard Holtz "Richard_991"
Reviews.Content: This item failed in first three months.  Not worth buying.  Maybe if it had a decent warranty.  Need to figure out what to replace it with

Reviews.Title: NetCam flop
Reviews.Author: Robert Tryon
Reviews.Content: I ordered new but was sent used, it came with the password and user name of the people that had it first. To see if was real we went on line, we got right on their site. So we know it was used. This netCam came without any guidelines for the use with your phone when you are away from home, it only works if you are in range of your wifi.

Reviews.Title: Its works OK but too expensive
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for what it is and does. I like that the setup works and Belkin streams it for free. Also like the design and excellent image and good audio quality. Dont like that it freezes after a while watching the app. FPS depends on your connection but even in the same wifi has a 2-3 seconds delay. Also dont like that it is a rebrand of a cheaper chinese cam you can find here at amazon, forgot the name but you can find it in another review.

Reviews.Title: Low Quality Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: ED
Reviews.Content: received the netcam wireless camera in the stated delivery window, but was quite surprised and frustrated that no tracking info was available throughout the entire period from the shipped date to the date of delivery! the best part of the netcam experience was its ease of connecting to my wireless network, even though the limited set-up instructions were lacking.the netcam is quite sluggish with responding to movement, even very slow movement. i attempted, unsuccessfully, to find and download the ipad netcam app. the apple app store displayed no such app for the ipad. lastly,  when viewing the netcam app, whenever the iphone goes blank, another app or display is immediately accessed, or if the netcam app is minimized, re-logging in to your netcam account is required each time! not good selling (and "netcam camera keeping") points...

Reviews.Title: Handy Little Gadget
Reviews.Author: Tamela Mccann "taminator40"
Reviews.Content: The Belkin NetCam Wireless Camera for Tablet and Smartphone has an easy set up; basically you plug it in, find your wireless connection, and download the app for your smartphone or iPad, and you are good to go. Despite that fact, I still managed to download the wrong app the first time, so be sure you download the BELKIN NetCam app, not just the NetCam app. Otherwise you're going to think the device is not working, and you may end up picking up a signal from another place.Once I got the device working, I really had no issues. It does what it says it will do:  I could see what was happening in my house, though there is a minor delay in action (Of course I tested it out by having it view myself). The images are a bit grainy and the motion isn't easy to see, but it does what it says it will do: It provides me with a way to see what I want to see going on when I'm not there.One design flaw I'd like to see corrected is there is no ease of transfer between wireless connections. I brought the device to my work to see if I could use it there and was unable to find a connection at all. I don't really know if it's user error or if the device, once set up on one network, will not work on another. It just seems like it would be much easier if the device were tied more to the app on the smartphone than to the wireless connection.Other than that one complaint, this is a handy device that will allow you to spy on whatever needs spying.

Reviews.Title: Grainy display but very easy to use.
Reviews.Author: J. Schneider "john_jps"
Reviews.Content: Setting up and using the camera was trivial: the included fold-out quick set up guide had me viewing the camera's output on my iPad in minutes, and online just minutes after that. The next day at work I was able to show my friends. In this sense it's wonderful.On the down side, the out is very grainy: it basically looks like your typical security camera: not a crisp HD image whatsoever. The infrared sensor is also merely "neat" but otherwise not terribly useful: you can't really distinguish anything other than size.All in all, if you intend to use it for simple security purposes, then it's great, but realize that the picture will be a little grainy.

Reviews.Title: Always looking for a good IP camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: I am always on the lookout for a good camera.  My idea of a good camera is something that doesn't take me a month to figure out how to set it up, one that takes a halfway decent picture, and one that allows me to record in some way off site, what is going on if I want to.My reason for wanting a camera is that I don't trust too many people these days and I want the ability to know what's going on at home while I am at work.  For me, this camera acts in 2 ways.  First, as a nanny cam.  I have a babysitter watch my kids 2 days a week in the midweek and I want to make sure that they are taken care of properly.  Eventhough this isn't a hidden camera, it serves well the purpose because the babysitter knows that I can watch and therefore is usually on her game.  The second reason for it is for security purposes.  This camera also does an okay job with this as well.  The night vision is good and the daylight picture is fine.Setup for this item was very easy.  From the time I opened the box to the time I was watching it on my computer was about 15 minutes.  Most of that time was looking for a place to put it that isn't already being used by another camera.For those reviewers that complain about the choppy nature of the picture, they need to realize that it is sending a wireless signal with sound and the size of that wireless signal going over an internet connection that is probably being taxed by other devices using the signal will affect this.  I do not find it annoying at all because it is what I have with my other cameras.  If you want one that is less choppy, then go with a camera DVR setup that connects directly to the interent over a high speed internet service.Picture on this unit is fine.  I can make out details of who is walking through the field of view so that in the event something were to need to go to court, I have what I need.  The downside is that because of the frame rate, some of the details can be blurry if the subject is moving very fast through the field of view.Sound is a bonus.  I don't need the sound but it is nice to hear the kids laughing when I am having a tough day at the office.Overall impression:  Yeah, there may be better cameras on the market, but overall, this camera performs as well as most others in its price category and worth looking at.  If you want a better system, you are more than likely going to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality Camera and Works Well
Reviews.Author: J. White
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions for setting up the camera and connecting to my wireless G network and was able to get it running with no problems.  I installed the webcam software on an iPhone 5 for testing.  The camera worked quite well with good quality during the day and usable quality in a dark room.  Audio Quality was acceptable. The unit seemed to run fairly warm to the touch but not so hot to be of much concern.  The only problem I see with it is that the camera does not have the capability to operate on a wireless N network.Overall I am really happy with it and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: Functional but is it Worthy
Reviews.Author: John N. Schëar "cxxi121"
Reviews.Content: When one follows the instructions it is unbelievable how well this works.  I am one of those who will read instructions until the words fall off the page; however, this time I used intuition and just installed it.  I should have read the instructions.  They work and consequently the Belkin NetCam works well too.I set this up in the "dog's room" and attached it to a Note II to determine if it works and how well it works.  It performs as well as any camera of this nature can work given that there is an understood delay between transmission points.  Let me quickly add that the delay is no more than 2 seconds in most cases and in some cases the delay is about 1 second.  Neither condition is a deal breaker but it could have a review devaluation of about .5 to 1 point.  I did not downgrade this camera because it works so well.  When we are away from home and call the dogs on the camera it is funny as can be so see them come to the camera and bark at it.  "Do not forget the treats this time, you old codgers" is their favorite reminder.  I would like to have been able to use it with Windows 8; however, either I cannot figure out how to make it work or the camera is strictly for Droid and Apple's iOS systems.  It does not matter a whole bunch since it works fine on the Note II.The video definition is decent and so is the audio.  The wide-angle is so much better than a spot type angle.  If there were multiple cameras throughout a location then perhaps a spot would be better but I prefer the wide-angle for most applications. Even the night viewing is stronger than I expected.  Overall, this is a quality camera and maybe it works so well since it is attached to a Belkin router and enhancer.  I did not attach the camera to another router to test, however.

Reviews.Title: Cute Compact Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: mk
Reviews.Content: This little netcam is a neat idea that allows keeping an eye via your smartphone or tablet. on your home with nightvison/infrared.I have no issues with this unit.  It sets up fast with the quick install quide: 1. Mount it on the wall with a removable base; the head sviwels up and around. I just let it rest on our mantle; 2. Plug it in, verify wifi light is blinking; 3. Download the app; 4.Connect and launch app- tap camera name to view camera and to assess settings.  One can have multiple cameras labelled in different rooms- cool.  One could use outdoors- just keep it weather protected or best, view outside through a window; 5.Set to video mode.The camera is wide-angle, but one is limited to one open room.  It does detect motion and will send e-mail alerts; one can save the video on their phone, and there's digital audio which is adequate.  The day/night imaging is fine.  We have 4 cats and a dog, and we see them quite well.Overall, I love it.  The smallness and utility of it is the future.  Finally, I have not tried it on the computer- next project- not a big rush for me; however, it does list for PC web viewing "from any computer"-> one has to go to their website and enter name/password from the Netcam app setup.  We'll see.  Happy viewing.

Reviews.Title: easy setup, works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Brian Koch "Aspiring Photographer"
Reviews.Content: The setup is fairly straight forward and has good step by step illustrations.  I had one small issue where I lost the connection with the wifi during initial setup, but restarting the process fixed this.  It is fairly clear for being an internet camera and streaming at 2 frames per second.  The night vision works well.  It does take a few seconds to load on my phone and there is a several second delay, but its nice to be able to keep an eye on the kids or sitter while we are out.  You can also add and label additional cameras with the app so I may eventually get more for other locations to be able to monitor more than just the living room.

Reviews.Title: Needs Work
Reviews.Author: Miller
Reviews.Content: Issues:A) If you login using a computer the site you login to is not secure (http rather than https). Interestingly, the site they have you post questions to Is a secure site.B) There appear to be audio issues. With both units I've tried I've either heard horrible static or a horrible high pitched noise. The actual audio is nearly impossible to hear because of this. I'm not sure if this is a problem with the microphone or with the feed from Belkin's cloud. Whatever the reason, it makes the audio component worthless. (Hopefully my two units were the exceptions). In addition, when viewing from the web there is no audio option (at least on the browsers I've tried).C) The booklet contained doesn't explain the settings and not all of the settings are obvious. Poor communication on the part of Belkin.D) Notifications of motion are only available via email. If your email is unreliable a thief could be rummaging through your home without you knowing. The app iCam offers very reliable push notifications that provide nearly, if not immediate, alerts. Belkin should offer this too.F) If you have more than one NetCam there is no split screen option to view. You have to view each one seperately.G) The NetCam can NOT be turned off via your computer or App. There is not even an on/off switch. In order to turn it off you must unplug it!When I've plugged it back in the App has a hard time retrieving the video feed again.H) The email notifications only include two images. If you would like to record more images or video you have to do it manually. Motion will NOT trigger recording of video and it is not an option.  Furthermore, you cannot record video directly to your computer.I purchased the NetCam because I wanted an easy to set up camera that would not require the running of a computer. The NetCam has potential but should not have been put in a beta testing stage at 130 dollars per NetCam.

Reviews.Title: Belkin Netcam F7D7601
Reviews.Author: vieka500
Reviews.Content: I bought this NetCam after trying a few others. I have been specifically looking for a network camera that has motion detection and email notification. This product has very limited settings. There seems to be no difference between a sensitivity setting of one (minimum) and 5 (maximum). I have left the camera running for several days and when I return I have little or no notifications. I have two cats and they don't trigger the motion detection. Sometimes I get email notifications with pictures lacking movement, there is nothing in the frame. I can activated the camera, leave for the day, come back and walk directly up to the camera and smile with no notifications.The limited sensitivity settings are a major draw back. The frequency settings are also minimal. There are two options. I have tried other cameras that allow many more setting like amount of pictures per second, amount of seconds to check once first movement is detected, amount of time to wait before checking for new movement once detected, and how many picture to email.I wouldn't not recommend this product if you are looking for a network Camera with motion detection and notification. It doesn't do it well enough.

Reviews.Title: peek a boo.. I see yall!
Reviews.Author: ak
Reviews.Content: Amidst installation warnings of "you must follow  these steps exactly as they are listed", and knowing easy it is to hit some stupid snag. I did it, it worked, and we're watching people make peanut butter sandwiches without their knowledge. But thus far I can only get it to report movement with email to one phone.. and Belkin, the manufacturer says, "that's all folks", no solution. But, other than that it works great..... Hey, what's Cameron's girlfriend doing eating my imported smoked cheese! Soon it will be a video on YouTube! Seriously, its nice to able to say " hey what's that sound down stairs?", and then just take a look which I can do on my tablet, or she can do on her phone. And I can do this from any location in town, and probably, where phone or WiFi goes.

Reviews.Title: Belkin camera
Reviews.Author: D. Marcus
Reviews.Content: Good camera overall. Setup was very simple. It is kind of annoying to refresh every 5 minutes on my phone Other than that I am pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Comparison with Motorola Blink1 camera
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: This is a comparison with the Motorola Blink1 Wi-Fi Video Camera for Remote Viewing with iPhone and Android Smartphones and Tablets, Black. The other reviews can give you a sense of this camera.SAME FOR MOTOROLA BLINK1:* Infrared illumination for night. This creates a surreal type of scene, since the shading is different than you'd expect with a black and white camera. It is very effective in giving you a view from a dark room -- without visibly lighting the room.* Set up involves pressing some buttons on the camera, switching your phone/tablet to the wifi network of the camera, creating an account, switching your wifi back to your home router. The camera appears in a list. If you have only one Motorola camera, you will only see one.BETTER FOR BELKIN:* Sharper image* Clearer night view* Wider angle (though the narrower angle of the Motorola is compensated by the ability to tilt/pan).* Much clearer, simpler manual.* Better looking camera, smaller box.BETTER FOR MOTOROLA BLINK1:* Belkin app does NOT work on the iPad.* You can tilt and pan the camera from your phone/tablet* If a scene is illuminated (bright), the camera switches to a color video view. (not b&w; IR).* Faster, nearly real-time video if you are on your home network. Not as good as facetime, but basically realtime. The Belkin is only 2 fps.* Stays connected. The Belkin auto-disconnects and you have to tap the screen and reconnect.----Personal preference: Although they both have flaws, I prefer the Belkin even though the specs are actually worse and it's a worse app. The Belkin is cheaper, and for the same money I could get two Belkins, which would be even better than a motorized Motorola.Also note the Belkin app for the camera does not support the Belkin WeMo Wi-Fi Baby Monitor for Apple iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch (Firmware Update), so you'd have to switch to that app to use a WeMo.

Reviews.Title: When it works, it's great...
Reviews.Author: VeeeeryInteresting
Reviews.Content: When it works, which is spotty at best, it works great. I am hopeful that Belkin will continue to update the servers and software and this will be the product it claimed to be. We didn't need it all the time, but when we did need it, it wasn't reliable. Sometimes it worked great, sometimes not at all.Things I liked about it- pretty good picture, good night time vision, great price, easy set-up.

Reviews.Title: Best product
Reviews.Author: ALLISTER DCRUZ
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Night vision is good, catches flies in the room.  If you speed up the rate of frames per second in settings you get a good flow.  Already own 3 of these.  Not sure about other products on the market, since i have nothing to compare them too. but these do the job just fine!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good
Reviews.Author: George Kaplan "George"
Reviews.Content: It might not be perfect, but the $100 price point does provide excellent image quality, decent (not excellent) motion quality, and easy, easy set up. The last point seals the deal for me, since so many netcams--often much more expensive than this Belkin camera--require all kinds of voodoo to work. This is dead simple to hook up to a wireless router, and the uptime has been admirable. I see others here reporting their routers are dropping the camera periodically, but in a month of daily use I have yet to experience any such problem.I will be purchasing a second one from Amazon to add to the first and increase my ability to view the household in my absence.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive for its ability
Reviews.Author: Lee Shornick
Reviews.Content: It's easy to configure and it's doing exactly what I expected.it to be able to do. Good value all the way around.

Reviews.Title: It's just okay
Reviews.Author: Richard Callari "rich cal"
Reviews.Content: Customer service is terrible never return my phone calls, Have some questions but how to work it out myself overall it's okay

Reviews.Title: Good for price!
Reviews.Author: BallaghMan

Reviews.Author: Eric Bautista
Reviews.Content: ...knowing that I can monitor my front porch (and I get an email notification with 2 still pictures when it senses motion).

Reviews.Author: C. Stephen Penix
Reviews.Content: Very happy and satisfied with everything including style and price.  This was a Christmas gift and was delivered as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Improved Over Time
Reviews.Author: Glenn R. Howes
Reviews.Content: When I first reviewed this camera in January of 2013, I gave it a scathing review mainly centered on the then unusable iOS app which was slow and badly designed. I set the camera aside, and many months later I've gotten back to it, a few revisions of the iOS app later, and whatever other improvements have been made on the central server. And much has changed; it's surprisingly useful and easy to use to the point I've raised my rating from 2 stars to 4.Hardware is decent. I especially like its dark room performance, where everything in a small dark room is discernible. There is significant latency; point it at yourself and it takes a couple seconds to register movements. So don't expect any useful two way communication, unless you want to simulate a mission to the Moon. Picture quality is quite good for a security camera.The app has progressed nicely works OK on both my iPhone 5 and my iPad Mini, although the app is not tablet optimized. I'm glad that Belkin has iterated on it. Launch time and time to seeing the video stream is still slower than I would like: it can take upwards of 10 seconds sometimes to actually see a video stream, although it will occasionally lock up awaiting the camera.  There is still room for improvement, but it isn't the mess it once was.Don't forget the username you provide Belkin's web portal, as you'll need both it and your e-mail address to reset the password on the account.I was able to use a Power Over Ethernet Adapter set to 5V to power the camera without the mess of a nearby wall wart.I took a trip to China recently, and this would have been useful to keep myself comforted my house was secure. I had 2 other cameras from another manufacturer, but I was always wondering how things were going in my basement. Peace of mind is a valuable commodity.

Reviews.Title: Belkin NetCam Home Vodeo is excellent
Reviews.Author: dba562
Reviews.Content: The Belkin NetCam Home Video is a great product, it's very easy to install and set up, it took me 10-12 minutes to complete, the picture is so clear, and even in a dark room just with little light, I still could see a good image. This give me a sense of safety that I could check my room at any time. The design is good looking and stylish. You don't want to miss it.
